content.content: 1008×630 27.1 KB  Last Week’s Activity (March 8 - 12) Monday  Inclusion Polls for the Formally Submitted proposals were live on Monday, January 12th, and ended on January 14th at 4 pm UTC. All 21 proposals and subproposals passed the Inclusion Polls and will move on to the Bundled Governance Poll. This includes:   Core Unit / DAO Structure MIPs Set & Amendments  MIP38: DAO Primitives State MIP39: Core Unit Framework MIP40: Budget Framework MIP41: Facilitator Framework MIP4c2-SP12: MIP16 Amendments MIP4c2-SP10: MIP0 Amendments    Keg  MIP34: Keg Streaming Payments Module MIP48: Streaming Payments via the Keg    Technical Proposals  MIP43 - Term Lending Module (TLM) MIP45: Liquidations 2.0 (LIQ-2.0) - Liquidation System Redesign    General Proposals  MIP46: Parameter Proposal Groups MIP47: MakerDAO Multisignature Wallet Management    Real-World Finance Core Unit Onboarding  MIP39c2-SP1: Adding Core Unit (Real-World Finance) MIP40c2-SP1: Modify Core Unit Budget (Real-World Finance) MIP41c4-SP1: Facilitator Onboarding (Real-World Finance)    Risk Core Unit Onboarding  MIP39c2-SP2: Adding Risk Core Unit MIP40c2-SP2: Add Core Unit Budget (Risk Core Unit) MIP41c4-SP2: Risk Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding    Governance Core Unit Onboarding  MIP39c2-SP3: Governance Core Unit - GOV-001 MIP40c2-SP3: Core Unit Budget - GOV-001 MIP41c4-SP3: Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding      Thursday  The Inclusion Poll Review happened on Thursday’s governance call.   This Week’s Activity (March 15 - 19) Monday   The Bundled MIPs Governance Poll went live on Monday and ends Thursday the 18th at 4pm UTC.  Result: ??? (will update later today)  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator, @LongForWisdom, will perform a Governance Poll Review during the weekly Governance Call. This reviews the outcome of the MIPs Governance Poll and will confirm which MIPs and Subproposals will be included in the final bundled Executive Vote.  Next Week’s Activity (March 22 - 26) Monday  This will be the beginning of week 4, the final week of the March governance cycle. The Monthly MIPs Executive Vote will go live on Monday, March 22nd. The vote will be active for four days; if the Executive Vote does not pass before the four-day limit expires, all of the vote’s bundled proposals will effectively be rejected.  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator, @LongForWisdom, will perform the Governance Cycle Review during the weekly Governance Call. Weekly MIPs Update #110   “Man rides curling tectonic plates on a surfboard”  Monthly Governance Cycle  1. October’s Ratification Polls The nine Ratification Polls for the October Governance Cycle passed, namely:   The Endgame Prelaunch MIP Set, comprised by:  MIP83: Recognized Launch MetaDAO Clusters MIP84: Activate Protocol-Owned Vault Emulation MIP1c4-SP1: Subproposal for Changing the Problem Space MIP4c2-SP27: MIP Amendment Subproposals MIP39c2-SP35: Modifying Risk Core Unit Mandate - RISK-001 MIP39c2-SP36: Modifying Strategic Finance Core Unit Mandate (SF-001) MIP39c2-SP37: Modifying Collateral Engineering Services Core Unit Mandate    MIP4c2-SP26: Facilitator Offboarding Process (MIP41c5) adjustments: The feedback period for Facilitator offboarding subproposals has now been shortened from four weeks to two week.  MIP41c5-SP12: Facilitator Offboarding (RWF-001): The ratified Core Unit offboarding for RWF-001 has precedence over this subproposal, rendering it obsolete.  MIP39c3-SP3: Offboarding the Strategic Happiness Core Unit (SH-001): The Strategic Happiness Core Unit has been offboarded.  MIP39c3-SP4: Offboarding the Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001): The Events Core Unit has been offboarded.  MIP39c3-SP5: Offboarding the Real-world Finance Core Unit (RWF-001): The Real-World Finance Core Unit has been offboarded.  MIP55c3-SP9: Legal & Risk Domain Work on Greenlit Collateral BlockTower: 258,000 Dai will be alloted to funding the underwriting and performing the legal work necessary to onboard BlockTower Credit.  MIP81: Coinbase USDC Institutional Rewards: An account representing MakerDAO will be onboarded to Coinbase Prime; 33% of the PSM’s USDC will be transferred into custody to earn USDC rewards with Coinbase.  MIP82: Monetalis/Coinbase Appaloosa: A 500M DAI RWA vault will be onboarded for the purpose of acquiring USDC via the PSM; a loan of USDC will be provided to Coinbase.   Vote Breakdowns The following table shows the vote breakdowns for each Ratification Poll. Endgame-related proposals are marked with .     Proposal Impact (?) Last Week’s Activity (August 24-28) Monday  The Monthly MIPs Executive Vote went live. The Vote was active for four days ending Friday, August 28, at 5:29:08 PM UTC.  The bundled contents of this Vote consisted of two subproposals:  MIP13c3-SP1: Declaration of Intent (Forward Guidance) MIP0c13-SP1: Subproposal for Core Personnel Offboarding      Result: The Monthly MIPs Executive Vote did NOT pass.  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) performed the Governance Cycle Review, summarizing August’s Governance Cycle and opening up the floor for feedback and questions from the community and discussing any plans for September’s Governance Cycle.  This Week’s Activity (Gap Week: August 31-September 4) Monday/Thursday  No polls or votes this week related to a Monthly Governance Cycle! September’s Governance Cycle begins on Monday, September 7. This week’s governance call (or at least my segment) can be used as a time to discuss any upcoming governance cycle activities as well as a chance for Authors of planned MIPs or Subproposals to inform the governance community of their plans to submit them to Septemeberr’s Governance cycle formally.  Next Week’s Activity (September 7 - September 11) Monday  September’s Governance Cycle officially begins on Monday, September 7. The Formal Submission period is September 7 to September 9.  This period is when MIPs/Subproposals in the RFC phase are proposed to enter the governance cycle.    Note: If you have any proposals in progress, I encourage you to submit them for review on the forums if you intend to propose them for a near-future governance cycle. Thursday  The Governance Facilitator will perform the Submission Review on the weekly Governance and Risk call to determine which of the formally submitted MIPs/Subproposals may be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, September 14.  Other News Collateral Onboarding  The PAXUSD and USDT Week Cycle Collateral Onboarding Governance Polls passed last week, meaning that the Executive Vote to official onboard them will go live on Friday, September 4. The Signal Request gauging the community’s sentiment around the LRC resubmission ended, concluding that LRC will be re-submitted into the September Governance Cycle.  Next month’s planned collaterals types are:  COMP LINK PAX Gold   LRC resubmission   August’s Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls ended today, and the results can be viewed in the Collateral Status Index.  Oracles Activity  The Executive Vote to Whitelist yEarn Finance on ETH/USD Oracle passed last Thursday.  Maker Protocol Activity  The Executive Vote to Activate Liquidations 1.2 passed last Thursday, as well.  MIPs Updates The following proposals are still in the Request for Comments (RFC) stage:   MIP20: Target Price Adjustment Module (Vox)  This proposal’s feedback period ends after September’s Governance Cycle, making it eligible for inclusion in October’s Governance Cycle.    MIP15: Dark Spell Mechanism  This proposal’s feedback period ended in August, making it eligible for inclusion in September’s Governance Cycle.    MIP14: Protocol Dai Transfer  Jon Thathmann @jthathmann is now a co-author and has agreed to help get this proposal re-submitted to a future Governance Cycle!    MIP17: Weekly Actual Debt Ceiling Adjustments  The new version of this proposal is still a work in progress. If anyone is interested in pushing this proposal forward, please contact me on the Maker Rocket.Chat (@charlesstlouis).    MIP13c3-SP2: Declaration of Intent - Dai Flash Mint Module  This proposal’s feedback period ended in August, making it eligible for inclusion in September’s Governance Cycle.    MIP13c3-SP3: Declaration of Intent - Strategic reserves fund (SRF)  This proposal’s feedback period ends after September’s governance cycle, making it eligible for inclusion in October’’s Governance Cycle.    MIP12c2-SP4: Domain Work Requirements for LRC  This proposal was rejected from August’s Governance Cycle but is eligible for resubmission for September’s Governance cycle (as mentioned in the collateral onboarding updates above).    Ongoing Pre-MIP Discussions to check out:  Vault Liquidation Mechanism for Centrifuge Trade Finance Assets: A Pre-MIP Discussion A Governance Chief Contract Redesign A Liquidation System Redesign  Adding a poll to prioritize collateral applications   /fin

Weekly MIPs Update #129   702×702 84.5 KB   Not sure when to post your proposals, what the cutoff date for modifications is, et cetera? Please refer to this forum post.  Weekly-Cycle Ratification Polls  Closed Short Ratification Poll   The short Ratification Poll for MIP55c3-SP15: Phoenix Labs Initial Funding SPF that went on-chain last Monday, passed. This 50,000 DAI SPF will fund the legal and incorporation expenses of Phoenix Labs, an R&D company focused on creating new products for MakerDAO.  1814×398 27.6 KB   Ongoing Short Ratification Poll   A short Ratification Poll for MIP92c5-SP1: Vault Setting Amendment Subproposal has gone on-chain today and will run for three days until Thursday, March 16. This subproposal recommends three strategies, each with a deposit limit of 1M USDC, to select investment strategies for USDC in the Yearn Vault associated with MIP92. You can cast your vote here.  Monthly-Cycle Ratification Polls The Ratification Polls for the March Governance Cycle start today and will run for two weeks! Since the list is pretty extense, they are ordered by category. Vote   MIP40c3-SP90: Modify GovAlpha Core Unit Dai Budget 2023-2024 MIP40c3-SP90 provides voters with a choice of three DAI budgets for the GovAlpha Core Unit for 12 months, starting on 2023-04-01 and ending on 2024-03-31. Vote   MIP14c2-SP4: Starknet CU Budget Extension (SNE-001) SNE-001 had an approved budget until July 2022. They currently have enough unused funds to cover expenses until March 2023. SNE-001 is requesting a budget extension of 123,000 DAI until June 2023. Weekly MIPs Update #98   1013×549 17.5 KB   The Formal Submission Window for August is now open! The Formal Submission Window for August is now open and will close on EOD Wednesday 3rd. There are six eligible proposals:     MIP Impact Estimation Author      MIP76: MakerShire Redux“Makershire Redux is a 10M pool allocated across Liquidity Pools to support DAI liquidity/utility and earn yield.”  High @Aes    Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001) offboarding proposal setThis set of proposals offboard the Events Core Unit (EVENTS-001).  High @ippy    MIP4c2-SP15: Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments“Makershire Redux is a 10M pool allocated across Liquidity Pools to support DAI liquidity/utility and earn yield.”  Medium @twblack88    MIP40c3-SP74: Modify DAI Foundation Core Unit budget (DAIF-001)“This Budget Proposal for DAI expenses aims to fund the activities of the DAI Foundation Core Unit (DAIF-001) as described in MIP39c2-SP17 adds Core Unit DAIF-001: Dai Foundation. This budget is necessary to fund DAIF-001 activities in its second budget year.”  High @sorenpeter    MIP40c3-SP75: Modify Oracles Core Unit Budget, ORA-001“MIP40c3-SP75 renews the Oracle Core Unit ORA-001 budget from July 1 2022 through June 30 2023.”  High @NikKunkel    MIP41c4-SP38: Immunefi Security Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding - IS-001“I have worked as Deputy Facilitator for Immunefi Security since its inception on Dec 2021 and, during part of its incubation period under SES, two month prior (Oct and Nov 2021). I have taken charge of the accounting, written status updates, and contributed to our core unit’s goals. Our current Facilitator, @travinimmunefi, continues to lead with long-term strategic planning, but is stretched thin by his many other responsibilities. Proposal Author Eligible for Submission      MIP4c2-SP15: Core Unit Offboarding Process Amendments" The original motivation for this amendment was to simplify and to clarify the Core Unit offboarding process. Recent examples (see MKT-001 offboarding: 1, 2, 3) have demonstrated several gaps in this process. Ratifying simple changes started small and, along the way, the ambitions grew into revisions for much of the Core Unit MIP Set. Thanks to generous contributions from GovAlpha we now have a cohesive MIP Set. The aim is to reduce harm to the DAO and community in the event of Core Unit disruptions. These changes are an attempt to make processes more transparent and orderly. In addition, edits to MIP38, MIP39, and MIP41 fill in process gaps, or streamline them, with additional documentation and/or templates. Weekly MIPs Update #64   An Endless Desert Ripples Before our Eyes  1032×587 157 KB    — RFC and FS Dates for reference and for existing proposals can be seen here.  As per MIP51c4: Calendar Exceptions, there will be no Monthly Governance Cycle in December, i.e., no Formal Submission Window and no Ratification Polls. So the desert is not actually endless—its appearing so is no less an illusion than those waving, vague palms that hover just over the horizon when the heat is at its most scorching. And is this a watery droplet that the sandy wind just carried onto my face?   Things to Come   Yes, it’s true that there will be no Governance Cycle in December and that the next Formal Submission Window will open on January 3rd—35 days from now. However, authors who want their proposals to enter January’s Governance Cycle must post them in the forum in nine days (on December 8) at the latest. I know of these upcoming proposals:  A SPF for a bounty for the creation of a legal communications framework for the DAO A StarkNet Engineering (SNE-001) budget A Chaos Labs Core Unit (incubated by SES) A Maker Talent Core Unit (incubated by SES) A Tech Ops Core Unit (incubated by SES)  Stuff to look forward to! Refreshing!   Also, there’s a number of proposals still in RFC that would benefit from your feedback. So please    Proposals in RFC     Proposal Extract Author     MIP55c3-SP2: Create RealDAO SPF to make Moloch-based SPVs “The purpose of this subproposal is to create a 50k Dai SPF to provide a prototype SPV DAO with a template code deference agreement”. @jameskmccall   MIP40c3-SP45: Modify Core Unit Budget, ORA-001 (Oracle Gas Costs) “MIP40c3-SP45 appends Maker Oracle gas costs to the Oracle Core Unit ORA-001 budget for August 1 2021 through end of March 2022. Last Week’s Activity (August 31-September 4) Monday/Thursday  There were no polls or votes that happened last week related to a Monthly Governance Cycle. Announced September’s Governance cycle is set to begin on September 7.  Weekly MIPs Update on the Thursday Governance and Risk Call.  This Week’s Activity (September 7 - September 11) Monday  September’s Governance Cycle officially began on Monday, September 7. The Formal Submission period is September 7 to September 9.  This period is when MIPs/Subproposals in the RFC phase are proposed to enter the governance cycle.    Thursday  The Governance Facilitator will perform the Submission Review on the weekly Governance and Risk call to determine which of the formally submitted MIPs/Subproposals may be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, September 14.  Next Week’s Activity (September 14 - September 18) Monday  Inclusion Polls for the formally submitted MIPs/SPs will be proposed on Monday, September 14, and will run until September 17 at noon EST.  Thursday  During the weekly Governance and Risk Call, the Governance Facilitator will perform the Inclusion Poll Review and confirm which of the proposed MIPs/Subproposals should be included in the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll the following Monday, September 21.  Other News Collateral Onboarding  The PAXUSD and USDT Executive Vote passed on September 5 and is available for execution tomorrow, September 8. Once executed, both collateral types will be added to the Maker Protocol. Next month’s planned collaterals types are:  COMP LINK  LRC resubmission   September’s Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls will go live on September 21. See the Collateral Status Index for reference.  Oracles  The Executive Vote to Whitelist yEarn Finance on ETH/USD Oracle passed last Thursday. The Executive Vote  to add Argent as a Light Feed passed on September 5 and is available for execution on Septemeber 8. The tBTC Oracle Whitelisting Polling Vote will go out tomorrow, September 8.  Maker Protocol Updates  The Executive Vote to Activate Liquidations 1.2 passed last Thursday.  MIPs Update Proposals in the Conception Phase MIPs   MIP21: Real World Assets - Off-Chain Asset Backed Lender  In short, this proposal defines a MakerDAO Module implementation for DAI borrowing with Real World Asset Backed Lenders.    MIP22: Centrifuge Direct Liquidation Module  In short, this proposal provides a vault liquidation mechanism for Tinlake based short-term loan collateral that entails letting a portfolio of said short term assets mature or refinance them off-chain and using loan repayments to settle the Vault balance.   MIP13c3-SP5: Declaration of Intent: Maker to commence onboarding work of Centrifuge based Collateral  Subproposals   MIP13c3-SP4 Declaration of Intent & Commercial Points - Off-Chain Asset Backed Lender to onboard Real World Assets as Collateral for a DAI loan.  In short, this proposal defines a plan to diversify away from on-chain crypto assets and bring in uncorrelated “Real World Assets” to Maker (especially collateral that is backed with credit quality).    Proposals in the RFC Phase   MIP23: Domain Structure and Roles (NEW)  In short, this proposal provides a flexible and consistent structural framework for personnel working for MakerDAO within any domain.    MIP20: Target Price Adjustment Module (Vox)  This proposal’s feedback period ends at the end of September, making it eligible for inclusion in October’s Governance Cycle.    MIP14: Protocol Dai Transfer  Jon Athmann joined as a co-author to LongForWisdom. The proposal is actively being worked on and could potentially be resubmitted to September’s Governance Cycle in the authors decided to.    MIP17: Weekly Actual Debt Ceiling Adjustments  The new version of this proposal is still a work in progress.    MIP13c3-SP3: Declaration of Intent - Strategic reserves fund (SRF)  RFC ends this governance, making it eligible for inclusion in September’s Gov Cycle.    Proposals in the Formal Submission Phase (so far)  MIP15: Dark Spell Mechanism  MIP13c3-SP2: Declaration of Intent - Dai Flash Mint Module  MIP12c2-SP4: Domain Work Requirements for LRC  New and Ongoing Pre-MIP Discussions:   New Discussions:  Vault Liquidation Mechanism for Centrifuge Trade Finance Assets Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module    Active discussions still happening:  A Governance Chief Contract Redesign A Liquidation System Redesign     /fin
I think the MIP13c3-SP5 is missing from the list of Proposals in the Conception Phase, right?
The Weekly MIPs update was posted on Tuesday and MIP13c3-SP5 was posted yesterday, so that is why it is not listed. I will make an edit to the update to add it.

Results:  The Executive Vote Passed on March 25 at 08:33 UTC and executed on March 27 at 08:34 UTC.    A Summary of the Accepted Proposals and what it means for MakerDAO:  The Core Unit MIP set will move to Accepted status. Core Unit MIP set related amendments will move to Accepted status and have their Pull Requests merged. RWF-001, Real World Finance Core Unit Proposals will move to Accepted status.  Mandate will move to Accepted Status. Budget of 40k DAI per month for an unspecified number of months will move to Accepted Status. Facilitator Onboarding of Sébastien Derivaux will move to Accepted Status.   GOV-001, Governance Core Unit Proposals will move to Accepted status.  Mandate will move to Accepted Status. Budget of 80k DAI per month for 3 months, April-June, will move to Accepted Status. Facilitator Onboarding of LongForWisdom will move to Accepted Status.   RISK-001, Risk Core Unit Proposals will move to Accepted status.  Mandate will move to Accepted Status. Budget of 100,500 DAI per month for 3 months, April-June, will move to Accepted Status. Facilitator Onboarding of Primož Kordež will move to Accepted Status.   The Keg module MIP set will move to Accepted status. MIP43: Term Lending Module will move to Accepted status. MIP45: Liquidations 2.0 will move to Accepted status. MIP46: Parameter Proposal Groups will move to Accepted status. MIP47: MakerDAO Multisignature Wallet Management will move to Accepted status. At the time of writing this, positive participation is ~4,000. What is it? Two Ratification Polls (and short ones at that!) are not enough to fill the void? Well, have you maybe heard about…  … Proposals in RFC?      — RFC and FS Dates for reference and for existing proposals can be seen on this proposal tracker. If you have any questions about the voting process at MakerDAO, the Practical Guide to Voting will be useful.  There are lots of proposals to review under the RFC subcategory! Yes, the Frozen Period is upon most of them, but even those might still benefit from your input. And even if they don’t…  Also, some of the proposals there will be entering July’s Governance Cycle, so there goes your objection. I don’t why you’re making this so difficult. I’m just trying to help. Weekly MIPs Update #65   Post your proposal before Thursday 9th or wait until February’s Governance Cycle!  1032×586 109 KB    — RFC and FS Dates for reference and for existing proposals can be seen here.   As per MIP51c4: Calendar Exceptions, there will be no Monthly Governance Cycle in December, i.e., no Formal Submission Window and no Ratification Polls.   Friendly reminder for @seth, @pyramidmaker, and @SES-Core-Unit, of whom I know they are currently working on proposals    Proposals that intend to enter January’s Governance Cycle must be posted at the latest on Wednesday 8th. The reason for this is:  That proposals that haven’t fulfilled their Feedback Period cannot be formally submitted And the Feedback Period spans a minimum of 28 days And the Formal Submission Window for January closing on Wednesday 3rd   Once posted, proposals will be open to overt community feedback and authors will have 21 days to act on that feedback (they must honor the one-week Frozen Period!). If you have any question, feel free to message me publicly or privately.   Things to Come   You can see all MIP-relevant dates for 2022 on the freshly updated MIP RFC and Formal Submission Dates post. Last Week’s Activity (September 7 - September 11) Monday  September’s Governance Cycle officially began on Monday, September 7. The Formal Submission period was from September 7 to September 9.  This period is when MIPs/Subproposals in the RFC phase are proposed to enter the governance cycle.   The following proposals were formally submitted to September’s governance cycle:  MIP7c4-SP2: Subproposal to Offboard Smart Contract Domain Team: Mariano Conti  MIP7c4-SP1: Subproposal to Offboard Risk Domain Team: Cyrus Younessi  MIP12c2-SP5: COMP Collateral Onboarding MIP12c2-SP6: LINK Collateral Onboarding MIP12c2-SP4: LRC Collateral Onboarding MIP7c3-SP4: Domain Team Onboarding (Smart Contract Domain Team) MIP7c3-SP3: Domain Team Onboarding (Risk Domain Team) MIP15: Dark Spell Mechanism MIP13c3-SP2: Declaration of Intent - Dai Flash Mint Module    Thursday  The Governance Facilitator performed the Submission Review on the weekly Governance and Risk call to determine which of the nine formally submitted MIPs/Subproposals may be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, September 14.  Result : Seven of the nine proposals were confirmed to move forward to Inclusion Polls.  The reason the two domain team offboarding proposals were not confirmed to move forward was that the mandated actors (with acknowledgment from the community) determined it was best suited for all Maker stakeholders that a mandated actor can offboard themselves voluntarily (without governance) as long as it comes with open communication to the governance community via a forum post / subproposal.  This will be the minimum requirement for domain team/mandated actor offboarding and will serve as reference/proof that the mandated actor did indeed voluntarily offboard themself.      This Week’s Activity (September 14 - September 18) Monday   Inclusion Polls for the formally submitted MIPs/SPs were be proposed on Monday, September 14. The polls ended today with the following results:   MIP12c2-SP5: COMP Collateral Onboarding: PASSED   MIP12c2-SP6: LINK Collateral Onboarding: PASSED   MIP12c2-SP4: LRC Collateral Onboarding: PASSED   MIP7c3-SP4: Domain Team Onboarding (Smart Contract Domain Team): PASSED   MIP7c3-SP3: Domain Team Onboarding (Risk Domain Team): PASSED   MIP15: Dark Spell Mechanism: PASSED   MIP13c3-SP2: Declaration of Intent - Dai Flash Mint Module: PASSED     Thursday  The Governance Facilitator performed the Inclusion Poll Review and confirmed that all of the proposed MIPs/Subproposals would be included in the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll the following Monday, September 21.  Next Week’s Activity (September 21 - September 25) Monday  On September 21, the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll will be published for the seven proposals that passed the Inclusion poll stage. The poll will run for three days ending on Thursday, September 24, at noon EDT.  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator will perform the Governance Poll Review as part of the governance meeting and confirm the poll’s outcomes in preparation for Week 4’s MIPs Executive Vote that will occur on Monday, September 28.  Collateral Onboarding  This month’s collaterals types going through the Governance Cycle are:  COMP  LINK LRC ETH-B collateral type (tentatively planned)   September’s Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls will go live on September 21. blimpa:  MIP4c2-SP21: Add Retrospection Process   I’m surprised that MIP4c2-SP21 is estimated to have a High impact. I would have expected Medium at most.

I’m not 100% sure this one should be considered high-impact, to be honest. I’m a bit torn: On the one hand, it adds a process that applies to all proposals, past and future; on the other hand though, the process as it’s been defined so far is more encouraged than it is required. As it is right now, I think this works better as a general recommendation that MIP Editors (me, that is) can implement as an internal process.

blimpa:  As it is right now, I think this works better as a general recommendation that MIP Editors (me, that is) can implement as an internal process.   The point is to invite others to swoop in and get involved in governance facilitation (in a small way). How does GovAlpha recommend delegates vote on this MIP?

Sir, even Ethereum prunes historical data. However, most of the conversations related to this MIP took place outside of the forum. I reckon the delegates have not followed this closely and might interpret it as an abstaining endeavor. However, while I say that a powerful blockchain prunes it’s historical data (especially now with the upcoming merger),  I can’t say the same for MakerDAO who to date has maybe 75 MIPs in total. Meaning it’s less than 2 gigs of data TBH…

Personally, I don’t think the changes introduced by this amendment would be effective. I laid down my reasoning here, but don’t click away – I’ll just copypaste them here:  I may be wrong, but I feel this proposal assumes the community will be paying attention to Retrospection Dates and act on them, while at the same time implicitly acknowleding (or is this just me misreading between the lines?) that engagement with proposals is not optimal. So I feel it’s presupposing what it’s trying to achieve. It assumes that community members will:  Pay attention to Retrospection Dates. When a proposal past its Retrospection Date is detected, consult with Facilitators whether the proposal is still useful. Where it’s not, remove it via a MIP4c2 subproposal; where it is, post a MIP0c15 (in tandem with a MIP4c2 for greater good, but not sure what the incentive is) to update its Retrospection Date.  I’m having a hard time picturing this. However, there is something to be said for retrospection dates. We don’t have any such (internal) process in place currently. The pruning, however, is part of GovAlpha’s Year-Ahead Plans.  I think the changes introduced by this amendment would just add to the stack of stuff that we will be pruning eventually.

psychonaut:  I’m surprised that MIP4c2-SP21 is estimated to have a High impact.   Somewhat late to the party. I added the high-impact tag to this proposal. My rationale was that it fits the criteria set out in the initial impact estimations post that:   Anything that permanently changes governance processes or structures within MakerDAO will likely be marked as high impact.   The addition of a retrospection process is certainly a permanent change to the governance process within MakerDAO. Happy to discuss whether or not we should have been more lenient on this occasion, or whether the high impact definition needs to be tweaked. Remember, impact estimates are just estimates and also:   We’re not infallible, use these estimates as a guide and not as a source of truth. If you have input on any specific estimate, feel free to bring it up in discord or in the relevant forum thread. In most cases (at least to start with) we will escalate impact estimates if requested by a member of the community.

Last Week’s Activity Monday  An Inclusion Poll for the Core Personnel Onboarding of @LongForWisdom was published. This poll determined that the subproposal to add @LongForWisdom as a Governance Facilitator would proceed to the Governance Poll in Week 3.  Thursday  Last Thursday, the Inclusion Poll for the Core Personnel Onboarding of @LongForWisdom passed with the following results: 5,529.13 MKR > 403.99 MKR + 3000 MKR (Default Inclusion threshold). On Thursday’s Governance call, the Governance Facilitator and community members reviewed the Inclusion Poll results. The result of the review confirmed that the proposal at hand would be included in the Governance Poll that went live this Monday (2020-05-18). In addition to the review of the Inclusion Poll Review, @LongForWisdom introduced two new MIPs (MIP13: Declarations of Intent & MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer) and announced that they have entered the Request for Comments (RFC) phase. The intention is to formally submit both of these MIPs in June’s Governance Cycle.  This Week’s Activity (Week 3 of the Governance Cycle) Monday  The Governance Facilitator submitted a Governance Poll for the Core Personnel Onboarding of LongForWisdom to be added as Governance Facilitator. This poll is still live until Thursday at noon EST (running for a total of three days)! The purpose of the Governance Poll is to determine if the subproposal to add  @LongForWisdom  should proceed to the final Executive Vote in Week 4 of the Governance Cycle.  Thursday  Tomorrow, the Governance Poll for Core Personnel Onboarding formally comes to an end, and the Governance Facilitator will perform the Governance Poll Review as part of the governance meeting in which they confirm the outcome of the Governance Poll in preparation for Week 4 of the Governance Cycle.  Next Week (Last Week of the Governance Cycle): Monday  The Executive Vote will be submitted if the Governance Facilitator confirms the ‘yes’ outcome of the Governance Poll during Week 3’s Thursday governance meeting.  Executive Vote Details:  The vote will have an expiration of 4 days, after which it has no effect. MIPs and subproposals only move to the ‘Accepted’ status if the executive vote they are included in passes within the 4-day limit. If the executive vote fails to pass within the 4-day limit, the MIPs and subproposals have their status changed to ‘Rejected.’    The first Community Greenlight Poll is Published (Collateral Onboarding)  The Community Greenlight poll will be published. The purpose of this poll is to give direction about what to do next regarding the active MIP6 applications. In general, the Community Greenlight polls will be published on the 4th Monday of the month to the 4th Friday of the month. The polls will run for two weeks. For further context, the Community Greenlight process is defined in MIP9. MIP9 defines the process by which MKR Token Holders can signal their judgment on the value of a potential collateral type before domain teams spend time thoroughly investigating its inclusion into the Maker Protocol. While domain teams are free to choose their workload, the on-chain governance polls provide the Domain Teams critical insights into the community’s sentiment for each collateral type that has been proposed via a MIP6 application. In addition to this, it is crucial to gather the opinion of MKR Token Holders towards the proposed collateral asset before the full domain work takes place. This process helps prevent work from being wasted on undesirable collateral types.    Thursday  The Governance Facilitator will perform the Governance Cycle Review as part of the governance and risk meeting, in which they summarize and discuss the past Governance Cycle with the community. This meeting is also an opportunity to discuss the upcoming governance cycle and potential submissions for the next governance cycle.  In Other News Collateral Onboarding  With respect to the transition to the collateral onboarding framework, I want to re-emphasize that we are all still in the transition period from the current collateral onboarding practices to the MIPs process. During this period, the community will continue to use the weekly cycle format for collateral onboarding this month. Given that the Community Greenlight poll results will conclude two weeks after they are posted, the MIP12 proposals that include the domain work for the agreed-upon collateral assets will not be ready for June’s governance cycle. In summary, this means that the domain teams will determine which assets they intend to work on and begin work on the deliverables throughout the month of June.  Related Community Calls   Community Collateral Onboarding Call (2020-05-20)   Agenda:  Continue the discussion that started last week on the Governance and Risk call regarding the [PC-DROP] and [CF-DROP] application. Go through other applications (such as [FIAT]) that are awaiting Domain Team Greenlight.   Video Recording

To help me understand the process… what happens if the executive doesn’t pass for whatever reason (eg all the stability fees are polled the current rate and there is a low participation) does @LongForWisdom  get put on future executives in perpetuity until he is officially voted in?  Or is this like, his one shot?

Hey @Jtathmann, MIP2 details the process of how Maker Governance can bootstrap the setup and implementation of the first Governance Paradigm. More specifically, it defines two phases:   Phase 1:  when a core governance framework is put in place and a functional collateral onboarding process is ratified.  Phase 2:  when the Problem Space is in the process of being addressed with MIPs and MIP Sets.  To answer your question, we are currently in Phase 1 of this process. Phase 1 states that if a MIP is rejected, it can be reintroduced to the community for another vote once the issues that resulted in its initial rejection have been addressed. So, it is not his “one shot”
Technically, it’s a sub-proposal and not a MIP. Though I’m not sure where we fell down on the whole ‘do subproposals count as MIPs?’ thing.

The poll passed successfully    Thursday  The Governance Facilitator performed the Governance Poll Review as part of the governance meeting, in which the outcome of the Governance Poll was confirmed in preparation for the Executive Vote to be submitted on the following Monday.  This Week’s Activity Monday  The Executive Vote to ratify @LongForWisdom as a Governance Facilitator went live on Monday. The vote successfully passed on Thursday, officially onboarding LFW as the second governance facilitator   The subproposal can now be formally assigned the ‘Accepted’ status.    The first Community Greenlight Polls were published on Monday  The community greenlight polls will run for two weeks as of this past Monday, ending on June 8. There is a total of 11 polls waiting to be voted on!       Thursday  The Governance Facilitator performed the Governance Cycle Review   During the review, I summarized and discussed the past Governance Cycle as well as the upcoming governance cycle and potential submissions for June.  Governance Cycle Recap (May)  The first governance cycle has come to an end   The first proposal to go through the governance cycle was successfully ratified. With the passing of this proposal, Maker now officially has a second Governance Facilitator! Three new MIPs were proposed over the month:   MIP13: Declarations of Intent  MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer  MIP15: Dark Fix Mechanism These proposals are in the Request for Comments (RFC) phase, so be sure to give feedback on them     Lastly, as we went through the first governance cycle and learned about what works and what can be improved, there were four Amendment MIPs published to further improve the governance cycle flow and allow the collateral onboarding process to be more efficient.  Next Week’s Activity (The first Week of the 2nd Governance Cycle) Monday  The first week of the second governance cycle begins on June 1. The formal submission period for June’s governance cycle is from June 1- June 4. This period is when MIPs/Subproposals in the RFC phase are proposed to enter the governance cycle    Thursday  The Governance Facilitators will do the Submission Review as part of the governance meeting and determine which of the proposed MIPs/Subproposals are in accordance with guidelines (defined in the MIP0 Framework) and should be included in the inclusion polls.  Collateral Onboarding Updates  Both the TUSD and USDC-B Governance polls passed this Thursday successfully    USDC-B Poll   TUSD Poll    The Executive Vote to officially add both the USDC-B and TUSD collateral types to the Maker Protocol went live today. Go vote! The community greenlight polls are currently in progress and will run for ~9 more days ending on Monday, June 8.  Lastly, since I got quite a few questions during the week regarding how the Community Greenlight Polls are scored, I wanted to go over it briefly in this update. The polls are scored as follows:   Score = Yes Votes - No Votes Score > 0 = Greenlit Score < 0 = Deferred   Note that the Community Greenlight poll scores are used to provide a reasonable first approximation of which assets domain teams should prioritize. However, this prioritization is not binding on the domain teams. Domain teams are free to determine the order in which they perform domain greenlight and domain work.    /fin

Thursday  The Governance Facilitator, @LongForWisdom, performed the Inclusion Poll Review during the weekly Governance and Risk Call and confirmed that the six proposals that passed the Inclusion Poll stage will move onto the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll on Monday, January 18th.  Next Week’s Activity (January 18 - January 22) Monday  The Monthly MIPs Governance Poll will be published for the six proposals that passed the Inclusion poll stage. This bundled poll will run for three days ending on Thursday, January 21.  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) will perform the Governance Poll Review to confirm the poll’s outcomes in preparation for the MIPs Executive Vote’s that will go out on Monday, January 25.  MIPs Activity Proposals in the Conception Stage:   MIP33: Maker Stability Price Module  This proposal allows Maker governance to defend an MKR price by pre-allocating dai to buy at a pre-defined level.    MIP35: Peg Stability Module - Compound Mixed Exposure - With Farming  This proposal defines a new Peg Stability Module which converts USDC to DAI and DAI to USDC, during the conversion it lends and farms the gem via a lender token and leverages the position using cDai using the same technique to farm it.    MIP36: Peg Stability - Compound Governance Dai Leverage  This proposal defines a Peg stabilizer actionable only by governance, which uses a flash minting technique paired with either MIP35 or MIP32 for Dai lending in order to leverage MakerDAO’s position on cDai.    Proposals in the Request for Comments (RFC) Stage: MIPs   MIP34: Keg Streaming Payments Module  This proposal provides a smart contract implementation of a Streaming Payments System for Maker.    MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign  This proposal defines DssGov, a contract replacement for DSChief that comes with improved security, usability, and functionality for holders of the Maker governance token (MKR).    MIP31: Active Reserve AMM (dss-ara)  This is a technical proposal for an active reserve based on the Uniswap V2 contract.    MIP32: Peg Stability Module for Compound Mixed Exposure  This proposal provides an extension for the PSM. The extension allows the PSM to leverage USDC via dai using cDai. It also converts USDC to cUSDC using the same join adaptor (lending join).    Subproposals   MIP13c3-SP9: Onboarding a new collateral type backed by B.Protocol (Declaration of Intent)  This proposal asks Maker Governance to declare its intention to experiment a native integration with B.Protocol. This Week’s Activity (Begining of June’s Governance Cycle) Monday (June 1)  Monday began the first week of the second governance cycle. The formal submission period for June’s governance cycle was from June 1 - June 3, when MIPs/Subproposals are Formally Submitted to enter the governance cycle and await the approval of the governance facilitators to proceed to the next stage of the governance cycle (Inclusion polls).  This month, nine proposals formally requested to enter the governance cycle:  MIP13: Declarations of Intent MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer MIP4c2-SP1: MIP6 Amendments MIP4c2-SP2: MIP8 Amendments MIP4c2-SP3: MIP9 Amendments MIP4c2-SP4: MIP12 Amendments MIP7c3-SP2: Subproposal Adding a Risk Domain Team Onboarding MIP12c2-SP2: Domain Work Requirements for KNC  MIP12c2-SP1: Domain Work Requirements for ZRX   Thursday (June 5)  During the weekly Governance and Risk Call, the Governance Facilitators (@rich.brown and @LongForWisdom) performed a Submission Review and determined which of the nine proposed MIPs/Subproposals should be included in inclusion polls next Monday.  The Proposals that will proceed to next week’s inclusion polls (7 total) are:  MIP13: Declarations of Intent MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer MIP4c2-SP1: MIP6 Amendments MIP4c2-SP2: MIP8 Amendments MIP4c2-SP3: MIP9 Amendments MIP4c2-SP4: MIP12 Amendments MIP7c3-SP2: Subproposal Adding a Risk Domain Team Onboarding  Note: The two MIP12 Subproposals to add KNC and ZRX were not formally accepted to enter the governance cycle due to some missing work requirements in the proposals. Note that the subproposals were declined as part of the MIPs process, but will instead use the weekly cycle until we can clean up and clarify the format for proposing MIP12 subproposals and figure out what exactly needs to be included in MIP12 subproposals going forward. Next Week’s Activity Monday (June 8)  The Inclusion polls will go out on Monday for the seven MIPs/Subproposals to determine if they should proceed to the Governance Polls in Week 3. The polls will officially end at noon (EST) on Thursday, June 11.   Reminder: Inclusion Polls occur when the governance community (MKR Holders) decides which proposals they want to proceed to the next step of the Governance Cycle. The Inclusion Polls allow MKR holders to have a significant impact early on in the Governance Cycle and serve as the threshold to necessitate the attention of a Governance Poll. For an Inclusion poll to successfully pass, the yes votes must be greater than the  Default Inclusion Threshold  plus the no votes. The default inclusion threshold is set to 3000 MKR.    Thursday (June 11)  On Thursday, there will be an Inclusion Poll Review as a part of the Governance and Risk call, where the Governance Facilitators (with support from the community) will confirm the proposals that will be put up for Governance Polls on the following Monday (June 15).  In Other News Collateral Onboarding Updates  The Executive vote passed yesterday to officially onboard the TUSD and USDC-B collateral types to the Maker Protocol. The Community Greenlight polls are still in progress for the next ~3 days, so don’t forget to vote!  MIPs Forum Updates  A New MIPs Forum Subcategory was added for Community members to discuss ideas for future Maker Improvement Proposals. The Proposal Ideas Category can be found here!

MIPs Activity January’s Formally Submitted Proposals MIPs  MIP29 - Peg Stability Module MIP30: Farmable cUSDC Adapter (CropJoin)  Subproposals  MIP13c3-SP7: Governance Communications (Declaration of Intent) MIP7c3-SP5: Domain Team Onboarding (Risk Domain Team) MIP7c3-SP6: Domain Team Onboarding (Smart Contracts Domain Team)  MIP28c7-SP2: Subproposal for Operational Support Domain Facilitator Onboarding(expected for submission)  (failed inclusion poll)MIP13c3-SP8: Maker Protocol Cover with Nexus Mutual (Declaration of Intent)   Proposals in Request for Comments (RFC) Stage: MIPs   MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign  This MIP defines DssGov, a contract replacement for DSChief that comes with improved security, usability and functionality for holders of the Maker governance token (MKR).    MIP31: Active Reserve AMM (dss-ara)  A technical proposal for an active reserve based on Uniswap V2 contract.    MIP32: Peg Stability Module for Compound Mixed Exposure  Provides an extension for the PSM. The extension allows the PSM to leverage USDC via dai using cdai. It also convert USDC to cUSDC using the same join adaptor (lending join).    MIP34: Keg Streaming Payments Module  The Keg is a tool for streaming ERC20 DAI to a preset group of addresses from out of the Surplus Buffer.    MIP37: Static Reserve For Governance  Defines a static reserve which can receive any tokens from anyone as any contract and allows Maker Governance to withdraw them.    Subproposals   MIP13c3-SP9: Onboarding a new collateral type backed by B.Protocol (Declaration of Intent)  An experiment is proposed for a native integration between B.Protocol and the MakerDAO system, by on-boarding a new collateral type, namely WBTC-B or ETH-C, with lower CR than WBTC-A or ETH-B (respectively), which will be natively backed by a strong commitment from B.Protocol backstop. Last Week’s Activity (June 8 -12) Monday  The seven Inclusion Polls went out on Monday, June 8, and ended on Thursday, June 11, at noon EST.  Thursday  The Governance Facilitators performed the Inclusion Poll Review for the seven polls. They confirmed which of the proposals can be included in the Governance Poll next Monday. All of the proposals, except MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer, were confirmed to move to Monday’s Governance Poll.  Note that MIP14 may be reintroduced to the community for another vote once the issues that resulted in its initial rejection have been addressed. If you have any feedback regarding MIP14, such as suggested improvements or arguments against, please comment on the forum post with your reasoning so that the Author can work to resolve them.    This Week’s Activity (June 15-19) Monday  Tomorrow, the Governance Poll will be published for the proposals that passed the Inclusion poll stage. The poll will run for three days ending on Thursday, June 18, at noon EST.  To reiterate the purpose of the Governance Poll, it is to determine if the proposals at hand should proceed to the final Executive Vote in Week 4 of the Governance Cycle, ultimately determining if they should become officially ratified or rejected.    The Proposals that will proceed to the Governance Poll on Monday, June 15 are:  MIP13: Declarations of Intent MIP4c2-SP1: MIP6 Amendments MIP4c2-SP2: MIP8 Amendments MIP4c2-SP3: MIP9 Amendments MIP4c2-SP4: MIP12 Amendments MIP7c3-SP2: Subproposal Adding a Risk Domain Team Onboarding  Thursday  This Thursday (June 18), the Governance Facilitators will perform the Governance Poll Review as part of the governance meeting and confirm the governance outcomes of the poll in preparation for Week 4’s Executive vote.  In Other News Collateral Onboarding Updates   @Mariano_Conti and members of the TUSD team spoke towards the TUSD Token Upgrades - video. Two Governance Polls for onboarding the KNC and ZRX collateral types to the Maker Protocol will go out on Monday, June 15, as a part of the Weekly Cycle. The Governance Polls will determine if the collateral types should proceed to an Executive vote on Friday, June 26 ultimately determining if they will be officially added to the Maker Protocol. The May 25 Community Greenlight polls have concluded, and the Collateral Status Index has been updated to reflect which of the collateral types have been greenlit. The next Community Greenlight polls will go out on June 22 in the final week of June’s governance cycle.   Note: If the amendments MIPs (more specifically, MIP4c2-SP3: MIP9 Amendments) pass at the end of the month, the Community Greenlight Polls will start on the 3rd Monday of the month and will run for two full weeks. This change allows the Community Greenlight Polls to conclude at the end of the governance cycle instead of carrying over to the following month’s cycle.    A New ‘Proposal Ideas’ Post Was Submitted  A “pre-MIP” discussion started last Wednesday regarding a redesign of the Maker Protocol’s liquidation system. The main goal of this “pre-MIP” forum post is to introduce a proposed solution for a liquidation system redesign and gather feedback in preparation for the creation of a formal Maker Improvement Proposal (MIP), which will contain more implementation details. I encourage all community members to take a look and provide feedback when you have the time.  A New MIPs Forum Subcategory Added   Polls and Votes  This read-only category will be dedicated to providing more awareness and notification of what is going in terms of voting during the current governance cycle. It will offer a go-to place to find the active Inclusion polls, Governance polls, or Executives Votes that are related to MIPs.  Note: The category was just created and is currently empty, but I will be updating it for the Governance Poll tomorrow.    /fin

Last Week’s Activity (June 15-19) Monday (June 15)  The Monthly MIPs Governance Poll  was submitted for the six proposals that passed the inclusion poll stage; this includes 4 amendment MIPs, risk team onboarding, and the declarations of intent.  MIP4c2-SP1: MIP6 Amendments MIP4c2-SP2: MIP8 Amendments MIP4c2-SP3: MIP9 Amendments MIP4c2-SP4: MIP12 Amendments MIP7c3-SP2: Subproposal Adding a Risk Domain Team Onboarding MIP13: Declarations of Intent   Four polls also went out for Whitelisting Oracles:  DeFi Saver on ETHUSD Oracle DeFi Saver on BATUSD Oracle DeFi Saver on WBTCUSD Oracle MCDEX on ETH/USD Oracle   Lastly, eight polls went out for Appointing and Proposing New Light Feeds. More specifically for:  Kyber Network Infura Etherscan Gitcoin    Note: All the Whitelisting Oracles and New Light Feed proposals that passed the governance poll stage will likely be confirmed in the Executive Vote on June 26 (earliest date). Thursday (June 18)  The MIPs Governance poll passed with zero no votes! The Governance Facilitators performed the Governance Poll Review as part of the weekly governance meeting. They confirmed that the six proposals (highlighted in the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll) would proceed to today’s Executive Vote. Video recording   This Week’s Activity (June 22-26) Monday (June 22)  Today, the Executive Vote to officially ratify the six proposals will be published.  The vote will have an expiration of 4 days, after which it has no effect. Note that proposals only move to the ‘Accepted’ status if the executive vote they are included in passes within the 4-day limit. If the executive vote fails to pass within the 4-day deadline, the proposals will have their status changed to ‘Rejected.’    Thursday (June 25)  The Governance Facilitators will perform the Governance Cycle Review as part of the governance and risk meeting, in which they summarize and discuss the past Governance Cycle with the community. This meeting is also an opportunity to discuss the upcoming governance cycle and potential submissions for the next governance cycle.  Note about July’s Governance Cycle:  Even though the next governance cycle is a few weeks away, I want to note that the formal submission period is July 8. If you have any proposals in progress, submitting them for review sooner rather than later is a good idea!  In Other News Collateral Onboarding  The two governance polls to onboard KNC and ZRX have successfully passed. They will proceed to an Executive vote at the end of the week, on Friday, June 26. Today, the new Community Greenlight polls will go out. This month’s Community Greenlight Polls are for:  LEND MATIC PAXG LINK ENJ WKT    Note that if the amendments MIPs pass at the end of this month, the Community Greenlight polls will start on the 3rd week of the governance cycle ending at the end of the governance cycle instead of carrying over to the following month. MIPs Forum Subcategories Updates  Proposal Ideas  This category is for community members to post and discuss any proposal ideas to improve the Maker Protocol and Maker Governance System.  The “pre-MIP” discussion for a redesign of the Maker Protocol’s liquidation system is still going strong. Again, I encourage everyone to take a look when you have time. There are now three other posts in the Proposal Ideas category! More specifically, the proposals are for:  Soft Locks and Future Guidance Bounties & Grants to improve governance and MKR protocol Decentralized MakerBroker     Polls and Votes   This read-only category will be dedicated to providing more awareness/notification of what is going on during the governance cycle in terms of voting. It provides a go-to place to see the active Inclusion polls, Governance polls, and Executive Votes related to MIPs.  /fin

Heads-ups  Monthly Governance Cycle: September The Formal Submission Window for the September Governance Cycle will open on 2022-09-05T00:00:00Z and close on EOD 2022-09-07T00:00:00Z. If you’ve authored a proposal that’s eligible to enter the September Governance Cycle, please do not introduce non-cosmetic changes after 2022-08-31T23:59:59Z. Last Week’s Activity (June 22-26) Monday (June 22)  The Executive Vote to officially ratify the six proposals was published on Monday. The Executive successfully passed on Thursday, June 25, at 18:42 UTC.  The six proposals can now officially move to the ‘Accepted’ status on the MIPs Github repository.    Thursday (June 25)  The Governance Facilitators (Rich and LongForWisdom) performed the Governance Cycle Review, summarizing June’s Governance Cycle and opening up the floor for feedback and questions from the community.  This Week’s Activity (June 29 - July 3)  No polls or votes this week! The July Governance Cycle officially begins on July 6. The Formal Submission period will run from July 6 to July 8. This period is when MIPs/Subproposals in the RFC phase are proposed to enter the governance cycle. If you have any proposals in progress, I encourage you to submit them for review on the forums if you intend to propose them for July’s Governance Cycle.  In Other News Oracles  The Whitelisting Oracles and New Light Feed proposals that passed the governance poll stage will be put up in an Executive Vote this Friday.  See last week’s update for the links to the proposals here.     Collateral Onboarding  The Executive Vote to add KNC and ZRX to the Maker Protocol successfully passed. Both collateral types are now officially added to the Maker Protocol.  The Executive Vote also raised the Dai Savings Rate Spread from 0% to 0.25% and the Base Rate from 0% to 0.25%.   The Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls will run for seven more days. This month’s Community Greenlight Polls are for the following collateral types:  LEND MATIC PAXG LINK ENJ WKT KNC    Important Note: Now that the MIPs Executive Vote passed, the Community Greenlight polls will now start to begin during the 3rd week (Monday) of the governance cycle and conclude at the end of the monthly governance cycle. MIPs Forum Subcategories Updates This category is for community members to post and discuss proposal ideas to improve the Maker Protocol or the Maker Governance system. There was only one new entry this week:   Adding a poll to prioritize collateral applications by @Andy_McCall

Last Week’s Activity (October 5 - 9)  Monday  Monday marked the first week of October’s Governance Cycle. The Formal Submission period ran from October 5 to October 7. The following ten proposals were formally submitted:  MIPs  MIP14: Protocol Dai Transfer MIP20: Target Price Adjustment Module (Vox) MIP21: Real World Assets - Off-Chain Asset Backed Lender MIP22: Centrifuge Direct Liquidation Module MIP23: Domain Structure and Roles  Subproposals  MIP13c3-SP5: Declaration of Intent: Maker to commence onboarding work of Centrifuge based Collateral MIP13c3-SP4 Declaration of Intent & Commercial Points - Off-Chain Asset Backed Lender to onboard Real World Assets as Collateral for a DAI loan MIP13c3-SP3: Declaration of Intent - Strategic Reserves Fund MIP12c2-SP8: BAL Collateral Onboarding MIP12c2-SP7: YFI Collateral Onboarding   Thursday  The @GovAlpha-Core-Unit performed the Submission Review to determine which of the formally submitted MIPs/Subproposals should be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, October 12.    @LongForWisdom confirmed that eight of the formally submitted proposals would move forward to the Inclusion poll stage. The two proposals that would not go up for Inclusion Polls were the two MIP12-Subproposals for adding BAL and YFI as collateral assets. These proposals were not included because the Governance Poll to take a more flexible and transparent approach to Collateral Onboarding passed, resulting in collateral onboarding to start using the weekly cycle. Therefore, the collateral onboarding proposals did not need to go through the Monthly Governance Cycle.   This Week’s Activity (October 12 - 16)  Monday  The eight Inclusion Polls for the Formally Submitted proposals were proposed and will run until October 15 at noon EDT. You can vote for all eight Inclusion Polls here!   Thursday  During the weekly Governance and Risk Call, the @GovAlpha-Core-Unit will perform the Inclusion Poll Review and determine which proposals are eligible for the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll on Monday (October 19).   Next Week’s Activity (October 19 - 23)  Monday  The Monthly MIPs Governance Poll will be published for the proposals that passed the Inclusion poll stage. The poll will run for three days ending on Thursday, October 22, at noon EDT.  As a reminder, for Inclusion Polls to successfully pass, the Yes votes for a given option in the inclusion poll must be higher than the combination of No votes plus the Default Inclusion Threshold (DIT).  Yes > (No + DIT) = Allows inclusion in the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll. The DIT is set to 3000 MKR.       Thursday  The @GovAlpha-Core-Unit will perform the Governance Poll Review as a part of the Governance and Risk meeting and confirm the poll’s outcomes in preparation for the MIPs Executive Vote’s that will go out on the final Monday (October 26) of October’s Governance Cycle.   Collateral Onboarding Updates  The Governance Poll to take a more Flexible and Transparent Approach to Collateral Onboarding passed today with the following results:  YES - 44,309.54 MKR NO - 0 MKR Therefore, the new weekly collateral onboarding process is now active.   YFI and BAL are currently going through the new weekly cycle collateral onboarding process and are both up for Governance Polls:  Add BAL as a Collateral Type - October 12, 2020 Add YFI as a Collateral Type - October 12, 2020   The Collateral Prioritization Framework will be made public next Monday (October 19)  The Collateral Prioritization Framework will be a publicly shared spreadsheet that anyone in the community can read to understand why certain collateral assets are getting prioritized.   October’s Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls will be published on Monday, October 19. The Polls will cover the following collateral types:    MIPs Activity  Proposals in the Request for Comments (RFC) Stage MIPs  MIP17: Weekly Actual Debt Ceiling Adjustments MIP24: Emergency Response MIP25: Flash Mint Module MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign MIP27: Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module MIP28: Operational Support Domain Definition  Subproposals  MIP13c3-SP6: SourceCred Funding MIP28c7-SP1: Subproposal for Operational Support Domain Facilitator Onboarding MIP4c2-SP6: Calendar Exceptions   Ongoing Pre-MIP Discussions New Proposal Ideas  FlapperDistributor: A Way to Distribute System Surplus while Minimizing Governance Liquidations 2.0: Technical Summary Replace the mechanism to burn $MKR with a treasury   /fin

Weekly MIPs Update #82   1035×588 25.5 KB   The Ratification Polls for the April Governance Cycle are now Up and Running   For this Monthly Governance Cycle we’ve had fifteen Formal Submissions. These fit neatly within twelve Ratification Polls: Three of them onboard a single Core Unit (EVENTS-001); two of them add the Collateral Engineering Services Core Unit (CES-001) as a collateral onboarding domain team. Here’s the full list:     Proposal Voting Portal      MIP66: Pairwyse Licensure"Pairwyse is an active protocol and blueprint for creating bespoke fixed-rate DAI lending and investment Agreements on MakerDAO between borrowers and lenders. We wish to thank the Maker Community for its previous feedback concerning the negative impact of patents on open source projects and potential concentration risks posed by fixed-rate innovations currently incubating in the Maker ecosystem. In posting this MIP, we wish to directly address these shared concerns with a fresh proposal we feel is favorable for MakerDAO, its contributors, its users and all current and future DeFi innovators throughout the collective ecosystem."  Go to voting page    MIP67: Methodology and Review Process for Structured Finance Transactions"MIP67 intends to (1) formally approve the Methodology for Review of MIP6 Structured Finance Transactions 17 published by the Real-World Finance Core Unit, and (2) introduce a high-level process that each MIP6-compliant application should undergo in order to receive, eventually, a positive endorsement from the relevant real-world CU stakeholder groups—e.g., RWF-001, SES-incubated Lending Oversight team, future CUs."  Go to voting page    MIP6c3-SP2: Modify the Collateral Application Form"The goal is to amend the collateral application template to contain relevant questions that allow Core Units and the MakerDAO community to more easily make an informed opinion on whether or not a collateral type is fit to be greenlit to be onboarded into the Maker Protocol."  Go to voting page    MIP7c3-SP7, MIP4c2-SP18: Adding CES-001 as a Collateral Onboarding Domain Team"MIP7c3-SP7 and MIP4c2-SP18 (a MIP7 amendment) add CES-001 as a Collateral Onboarding Domain Team."  Go to voting page    MIP47c3-SP1: Dissolution of Content Production, MKT-001, Multi-Sig Request"Now that the Content Production Core Unit has been offboarded, their wallet should be removed from the recognized multi-sig list. Currently, no funds are available in the multi-sig, but it can still claim ~3.8k DAI from their canceled budget stream."  Go to voting page    MIP39c2-SP30: Governance Communications Core Unit, COM-001, Mandate Refresh"MIP39c2-SP30 updates the mandate for Core Unit COM-001. The Governance Communications Core Unit performs a set of programs that focus on MakerDAO’s informational accessibility, stakeholder coordination, and communication practices as a decentralized and public organization." Weekly MIPs Update #120   1001×743 130 KB   January’s Ratification Polls are now Up and Running   Fifteen Ratification Polls went up today and will run until Monday 23rd:     Code and Title Summary Voting Portal     MIP92: Onboard PSM USCD to Yearn to earn Yield MIP92 will onboard a maximum of $100M of PSM USDC into a bespoke non-custodial Yearn vault. Link   MIP4c2-SP28: Amend MIP51 to Remove MIP51c4 (Calendar Exceptions) The December exception in MIP51 has been made in a time with huge problems on getting anything done in the Maker on-chain governance. This amendment removes the December exception so we can continue to govern the protocol without a break. Link   MIP4c2-SP29: Amend MIP61 to tighten up Recognized Delegate Participation Metrics This amendment proposes two changes to the Recognized Delegate Compensation MIP. (i) Setting a minimum threshold of non-abstaining votes for compensation eligibility and (ii) increasing the participation requirements in the case of executive votes. This Ratifcation Poll uses Ranked Choice Voting. Link   MIP4c2-SP31: MIP63 Maker Keeper Network Amendment This amendment to MIP63 defines more strictly how payments are sent and buffers reported. Furthermore, it makes stream durations explicit (versus the current implicit 6-month duration). Finally, the amendment makes it possible for the sequencer to set custom windows per network. Link   MIP4c2-SP32: Remove MIP14c4 (Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling) MIP14c4 places a cap on the total amount of DAI that can be distributed through MIP14. Rather than dealing with sequential subproposals to raise the Protocol DAI Transfer Ceiling, or setting it to an arbitrarily high number that renders it useless, it makes more sense to simply remove this restriction. Link   MIP4c4-SP2: MIP14 Repeal In an effort to simplify the growing body of DAO governance processes and policies, this subproposal repeals MIP14 in its entirety due to obsolescence. Link   MIP4c4-SP3: Obsolete MIP Removal (MIP23, MIP28) This subproposal removes MIP23 and MIP28 as the Domain framework they define has been superseded. Link   MIP13c3-SP13: Declaration of Intent to Develop a Comprehensive On-chain Monitoring Solution for RWA Vaults Current RWA monitoring is lagging behind as much as 13 months in the case of New Silver. MakerDAO is scaling up RWA vaults for yield and diversification. We need to develop maximum transparency around that. Link   MIP14c2-SP1: Requesting Protocol DAI Transfer to fund TechOps CU for February 2023 This amount will sustain the team, critical infrastructure, tools and services through the month of February. Link   MIP14c2-SP2: Protocol DAI Transfer to Fund IS-001 from Dec 2022 to May 2023 This amount will sustain the team and services through May by which point we anticipate dissolving as a Core Unit and becoming an EndGame ecosystem actor. Link   MIP39c3-SP7: Core Unit Offboarding (COM-001) This is an offboarding proposal for the GovComms Core Unit that includes both a golden parachute based on salary for the two permanent Core Unit members and retroactive MKR compensation for all contributors. Retroactive MKR compensation is denominated in DAI. Link   MIP55c3-SP12: Commercial Risk and Legal Domain Work to Support SF-001 Expanded Mandate Related to RWAs This SPF requests a 209K DAI transfer to support the expanded SF-001 mandate regarding RWAs. Link   MIP55c3-SP13: Special Purpose Fund for developing Proof-of-Performance for Viridian Cluster This MIP will set up a Special Purpose Fund of 500k DAI to fund a set of RWA projects to be undertaken by the Viridian Cluster 5 within the 6-month period of Jan 2023 - Jun 2023 Link   MI55c3-SP14: Defense Fund This SPF requests 5 million DAI for establishing a Defense Fund which will have the purpose of reimbursing legal defense expenses incurred by active participants of MakerDAO in case they are the target of legal or regulatory action. Link   MIP63c4-SP5: Onboard-Amend Keeper Network - Chainlink Automation Chainlink Automation enables decentralized, cost-efficient, and highly secure automation for smart contracts. Link     Proposals in RFC   Here’s a non-exhaustive list of proposals in RFC, open to feedback and suggestions.     Code and Title Impact (?) 854×533 22.2 KB Last Week’s Activity (January 25 - January 29) Monday  The Monthly MIPs Executive Vote for January was published.  Results: The Executive passed on January 28 and was executed on January 30 at 06:51 UTC.  The following MIPs and Subproposals have moved to the Accepted status: MIPs  MIP29 - Peg Stability Module MIP30: Farmable cUSDC Adapter (CropJoin)  Subproposals  MIP13c3-SP7: Governance Communications (Declaration of Intent) MIP7c3-SP5: Domain Team Onboarding (Risk Domain Team) MIP7c3-SP6: Domain Team Onboarding (Smart Contracts Domain Team) MIP28c7-SP2: Subproposal for Operational Support Domain Facilitator Onboarding  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) performed the Governance Cycle Review, summarizing January’’s Governance Cycle and opened the floor for discussion about the plans for February’s Governance Cycle.  This Week’s Activity (February 1 - February 5) Monday  Monday marks the beginning of February’s Governance Cycle! The Formal Submission period officially begins on Monday, February 1 and ends February 3 EOD UTC.  To all the Authors of proposals who have completed their RFC period, please reach out if you have questions about the Formal Submission process.    Thursday  The Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) will perform the Submission Review to confirm which of the formally submitted MIPs/Subproposals should be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, February 8.  MIPs Activity Proposals in the Conception Stage MIPs   MIP44: Reward Join Adapter (RewardJoin)   Proposes a generic vault solution for all tokens with reward.    Subproposals   MIP39c2-SP1: Adding Core Unit (Real-World Finance)  Proposes a Core Unit to pursue Real-World Asset work and more generally helps MakerDAO to take over the traditional finance world.    MIP40c2-SP1: Modify Core Unit Budget (Real-World Finance)  Proposes to officially onboard the informal RWA team using the new Core Unit framework    MIP41c4-SP1: Facilitator Onboarding (Real-World Finance)  Proposes to officially onboard Sébastien Derivaux as a Core Unit Facilitator for RWF.    Proposals in the Request for Comments (RFC) Stage (18!!) MIPs  MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign  MIP31: Active Reserve AMM (dss-ara)  A technical proposal for an active reserve based on Uniswap V2 contract.    MIP32: Peg Stability Module for Compound Mixed Exposure  Provides an extension for the PSM. The extension allows the PSM to leverage USDC via dai using cdai. It also convert USDC to cUSDC using the same join adaptor (lending join).    MIP33: Maker Stability Price Module  This proposal allows the governance to defend a MKR price by pre-allocating dai to buy at a pre-defined level.    MIP34: Keg Streaming Payments Module  This proposal provides a smart contract implementation of a Streaming Payments System for Maker.    MIP35: Peg Stability Module - Compound Mixed Exposure - With Farming  This proposal defines a new Peg Stability Module which converts USDC to DAI and DAI to USDC.    MIP36: Peg Stability - Compound Governance Dai Leverage  This proposal defines a Peg stabilizer controlled by governance, which uses the flash minting technique with MIP35 or MIP32 for Dai lending to leverage MakerDAO’s position on cDai.    MIP37: Static Reserve For Governance  Defines a static reserve which can receive any tokens from anyone as any contract and allow the Governance to withdraw them.    MIP38: DAO Primitives State  Defines all the state related to Core Units, Budgets and Facilitators.    MIP39: Core Unit Framework  Defines a framework for managing Core Units and modifying them in the DAO Primitives State MIP.    MIP40: Budget Framework  Defines a framework for managing budgets and modifying them in the DAO Primitives State MIP.    MIP41: Facilitator Framework  Defines a framework with subproposal processes for managing Facilitators and modifying them in the DAO Primitives State MIP.    MIP42: Proposed Compensation Addendum for MakerDAO Contributors  Proposes to pay contributors partially in time-locked MKR to increase value returned to contributors and directly align their interests with those of MakerDAO.    MIP43 - Term Lending Module (TLM)  Proposes a Maker module to buy and hold tokenized fixed-rate, fixed-term loans to maturity in order to encourage a fixed-rate lending market.    Subproposals   MIP13c3-SP9: Onboarding a new collateral type backed by B.Protocol  This Declaration of intent asks MakerDAO to consider an experiment for a native integration between B.Protocol and the MakerDAO system, by on-boarding a new collateral type, namely WBTC-B or ETH-C, with lower CR than WBTC-A or ETH-B (respectively), which will be natively backed by a strong commitment from B.Protocol backstop.    MIP4c2-SP10: MIP0 Amendments  Proposes edits to MIP0 that makes it compatible with the newly proposed Domain Framework MIP set.    MIP4c2-SP11: MIP5 Amendments  Proposes edits to MIP5 that makes it compatible with the newly proposed Core Unit Operating Model MIP set. The main change included is to the Governance Facilitator Emergency Vote process, which directly deals with onboarding and offboarding Facilitators.    MIP4c2-SP12: MIP16 Amendments  Proposes edits to MIP16 that makes it compatible with the newly proposed Core Unit Operating Model MIP set. The main change proposed is to clarify the Governance Powers of Facilitators.    Pre-MIP Discussions New Discussions! Last Week’s Activity (July ) Monday  July’s Governance Cycle began on Monday, July 6. Formal Submission of MIPs and Subproposals started July 6 and ended on July 8.  The Formal Submission entries for July’s Governance Cycle:   MIPs  MIP16: The Weekly Governance Cycle MIP17: Weekly Actual Debt Ceiling and Actual Risk Premium Adjustments MIP18: Meta-Parameter Adjustments MIP19: Liquidations System 1.1 Upgrade    Sub-Proposals  MIP18c4-SP1: Subproposal for Modifying Meta-Parameter Adjustments MIP12c2-SP3: Domain Work Requirements for the Onboarding of MANA MIP4c2-SP5: MIP12 Amendments      Proposals that are still in the Request for Comments (RFC) stage:   MIPs   MIP14: Protocol DAI Transfer  MIP15: Dark Fix Mechanism     Sub-Proposals   MIP13c3-SP1: Declaration of Intent: (Forward Guidance) (NEW ENTRY)     The previous Governance Cycle’s Community Greenlight Polls ended on Monday, July 6, and the Collateral Status Index was updated to reflect the results.  Thursday  The Governance Facilitators (@rich.brown and @LongForWisdom) performed the Submission Review to determine which of the seven formally submitted MIPs/Subproposals should be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, July 13. It was determined that all of the seven proposals would go through to the Inclusion Poll stage.  This Week’s Activity (July ) Monday  Inclusion Polls for the seven MIPs/SPs that have been formally submitted will be proposed on Monday, July 13, and will run until July 16 at noon EST.  Thursday  During the weekly Governance and Risk Call, the Governance Facilitators will perform the Inclusion Poll Review and determine which of the seven proposed MIPs/Subproposals should be included in the Governance Poll the following Monday (July 20).  Other News Collateral Onboarding  This month we have MANA and LEND going through Governance  MANA will go through the Monthly Cycle LEND will go through the Weekly Cycle  LEND will use the Weekly Cycle due to an issue with MIP12 requirements that will be fixed with this month’s MIP12 Amendment.     The next Community Greenlight Polls will go live on Monday, July 20 (third week of the Governance Cycle) and will contain the following collateral types:  [PAX] [WiV] [EURS] [LRC] [renBTC] [AMPL] [HUSD] [USDT] [C20] [BNT] [COMP]    MIPs Forum Subcategories Updates  Two new Pre-MIP Discussions were posted to the MIPs’ Proposal Ideas’ Subcategory:  Peg Stabilization Modules (PSM) Governance Chief Contract Redesign     /fin
