This Week’s Activity (October 19 - 23) Monday  The (bundled) Monthly MIPs Governance Poll was published for the eight proposals that passed the Inclusion poll stage. The bundled poll ran for three days ending on today at 4 pm UTC.   Results:   Yes Votes = 61,584.96 MKR No Votes = 0 MKR    Monthly MIPs Governance Poll (Bundled Proposals): MIPs  MIP14: Protocol Dai Transfer MIP20: Target Price Adjustment Module (Vox) MIP21: Real-World Assets - Off-Chain Asset-Backed Lender MIP22: Centrifuge Direct Liquidation Module MIP23: Domain Structure and Roles  Subproposals  MIP13c3-SP5: Declaration of Intent: Maker to commence onboarding work of Centrifuge based Collateral MIP13c3-SP4 Declaration of Intent & Commercial Points - Off-Chain Asset-Backed Lender to onboard Real-World Assets as Collateral for a DAI loan MIP13c3-SP3: Declaration of Intent - Strategic Reserves Fund MIP12c2-SP8: BAL Collateral Onboarding MIP12c2-SP7: YFI Collateral Onboarding  Thursday  Today, the Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) performed the Governance Poll Review to confirm the poll’s outcome (it’s successful passing) in preparation for next week’s MIPs Executive Vote.  Next Week’s Activity (October 26 - 30) Monday  Monday marks the start of the final week of October’s Governance Cycle. The Monthly MIPs Executive Vote will be published and will be active for four days. If the Executive Vote does not pass before the four-day time limit expires, all of the bundled proposals in the Vote will effectively be rejected.  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) will perform the Governance Cycle Review, summarizing October’s Governance Cycle and opening up the floor for feedback and questions from the community and discussing any plans for November’s Governance Cycle.  Collateral Onboarding Updates   YFI and BAL Governance Polls successfully passed. The Executive Vote to officially add them to the Maker Protocol is scheduled for next week (Friday, October 30).  PAXG and GUSD Collateral Onboarding Governance Polls will go out Monday, October 26.  The Collateral Prioritization Framework has officially been released!  The Collateral Onboarding Framework is a model that compares and prioritizes collateral types objectively, based on defined metrics and weights to seed intelligent discussions and inform the domain teams on which collateral types to prioritize. It’s important to note that the framework will not be the only tool used when the domain teams choose what collateral assets they will prioritize. Forum Post Announcement    The Community Greenlight Polls for October were published on Monday and will run until November 2. There is a total of 11 polls covering the collateral types displayed in the image below:  Screen Shot 2020-10-14 at 4.28.21 PM692×612 57.8 KB MIPs Activity Proposals in the Request for Comments (RFC) Stage: MIPs  MIP17: Weekly Actual Debt Ceiling Adjustments  MIP24: Emergency Response  Recently updated by @DavidU as he joins as one of the proposal’s authors.   MIP25: Flash Mint Module MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign MIP27: Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module MIP28: Operational Support Domain Definition  Subproposals  MIP13c3-SP6: SourceCred Funding MIP28c7-SP1: Subproposal for Operational Support Domain Facilitator Onboarding MIP4c2-SP6: Calendar Exceptions  Important Note: Final changes to proposals in the RFC phase must be added before October 28 to be eligible for inclusion in November’s Governance cycle. This results from the 1-week frozen period (when no changes can be made to proposals) that proposals have to go through before being Formally Submitted to a Governance Cycle. Last Week’s Activity (July 13 - 17) Monday  The Inclusion Polls for the seven MIPs/SPs were proposed and ended on Thursday at noon EDT. All Inclusion Polls passed except the for the MIP12 Amendments / MIP17 proposals.  Both of these proposals may be reintroduced to the community for another vote once the issues that resulted in its initial rejection have been addressed.    Thursday   The Governance Facilitators performed the Inclusion Poll Review and confirmed that five of the proposed MIPs/Subproposals would be included in the Governance poll next Monday (July 20). The proposals that will be included in the Monthly MIPs Governance Polls are:   MIPs  MIP16: The Weekly Governance Cycle MIP18: Meta-Parameter Adjustments MIP19: Liquidations System 1.1 Upgrade    Sub-Proposals  MIP18c4-SP1: Subproposal for Modifying Meta-Parameter Adjustments MIP12c2-SP3: Domain Work Requirements for the Onboarding of MANA    This Week’s Activity (July 20 - 24) Monday  Today, the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll will be published for the five proposals that passed the Inclusion poll stage. The poll will run for three days ending on Thursday, July 23, at noon EDT.  Thursday  The Governance Facilitators will perform the Governance Poll Review as part of the governance meeting and confirm the poll’s outcomes in preparation for Week 4’s MIPs Executive Vote that will occur on Monday, July 27.  Other News Collateral Onboarding  This month we have MANA and LEND going through Governance  MANA is using the Monthly Cycle and is proceeding to the Monthly MIPs Governance poll today. LEND to use the Weekly Cycle and is predicted to be proposed in the 4th week of July’s Governance Cycle.   This month’s Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls will go live today as well (Monday July 20th) and will run for two weeks. The Community Greenlight Polls are for the following collateral types:  [PAX] [WiV] [EURS] [LRC] [renBTC] [AMPL] [HUSD] [USDT] [C20] [BNT] [COMP]    MIPs Recent Activity   MIP20: Target Price Adjustment Module (in RFC)  In short, this proposal defines a process for adjusting DAI’s target price according to a governance-defined rate, allowing the institution of negative effective interest rates.    MIP13c3-SP1: Declaration of Intent for Forward Guidance (in RFC)  In short, this proposal aims to help Vault users hedge their exposure to the base rate via various derivative contracts.    TUSD Update   Concerns Surrounding the TUSD Collateral Type (Forum Poll to determine the next steps for the TUSD collateral type)  This forum poll will be live for ~3 more days. After that, it will move to an on-chain ranked-choice poll, and then to an Executive Vote.     /fin

This Week’s Activity (November 2 - 6) Monday  Monday marked the beginning of November’s Governance Cycle! Formal Submission began on Monday, November 2, and ended on Wednesday, November 5.  Formally Submitted Proposals: MIPs  MIP24: Emergency Voting System MIP25: Flash Mint Module MIP27: Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module MIP28: Operational Support Domain Definition  Subproposals  MIP4c2-SP6: Calendar Exceptions MIP13c3-SP6: SourceCred Funding MIP28c7-SP1: Subproposal for Operational Support Domain Facilitator Onboarding  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) performed the Submission Review and determined that all of the formally submitted MIPs/Subproposals will be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, November 9.  Next Week’s Activity (November 9 - 13) Monday  Inclusion Polls for the seven Formally Submitted proposals will be proposed on Monday, November 9, and will run until November at 4 pm UTC. As a reminder, for Inclusion Polls to successfully pass, the Yes votes for a given option in the inclusion poll must be higher than the combination of No votes plus the Default Inclusion Threshold (DIT).  Yes > (No + DIT) = Allows inclusion in the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll. The DIT is set to 3000 MKR.    Thursday  The Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) will perform the Inclusion Poll Review during the weekly Governance and Risk Call and determine which proposals are eligible for the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll Monday (November 16).  Collateral Onboarding Updates  The Executive Vote to officially onboard YFI and BAL to the Maker Protocol’s is scheduled for this Friday, November 6.  PAXG and GUSD Collateral Onboarding Governance Polls both successfully passed. The Executive Vote to officially add the assets to the Maker Protocol will be scheduled within 30 days. The Community Greenlight Polls for November will be published on November 16 and will run until November 30.  The Community Greenlight Polls will cover the following Collateral types:  [NEXO] [YFII] For more details on the status of Collateral Onboarding, check out the Collateral Prioritization Framework spreadsheet here. Last Week’s Activity (July 20 - 24) Monday  The Monthly MIPs Governance Poll was published for the five proposals that passed the Inclusion poll stage. The poll ran for three days ending last Thursday at noon EDT.  The Governance Poll passed with the following results:  Yes Votes = 18,125.55 MKR No Votes = 0 MKR      Thursday  The Governance Facilitator performed the Governance Poll Review as part of the governance meeting and confirmed the poll’s outcome in preparation for the Monthly MIPs Executive Vote on July 27.  This Week’s Activity (July 27 - 31) Monday  Yesterday, the Monthly Governance Cycle Executive Vote went live and passed today (July 28). Below is a twitter thread on what the implemented changes mean for Maker:  https://twitter.com/CharlieStLouis/status/1288127698263347206    Thursday  The Governance Facilitator will perform the Governance Cycle Review as part of the governance and risk meeting. This includes summarizing and discussing July’s Governance Cycle with the community. This meeting is also an opportunity to discuss the upcoming governance cycle and any potential submissions.  Next Week’s Activity (The Next Governance Cycle Starts on August 3) Monday  On Monday, August’s Governance Cycle Officially Begins. There will be no polls or votes this week! The Formal Submission period will run from August 3 to August 5. This period is when MIPs/Subproposals in the RFC phase are proposed to enter the governance cycle.  As a side note, if you have any proposals in progress, I encourage you to submit them for review on the forums if you intend to propose it in a near-term Governance Cycle.    Thursday  The Governance Facilitator will perform the Submission Review to determine which of the formally submitted MIPs/Subproposals should be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, August 10.  Other News Collateral Onboarding  MANA was officially onboarded to the Maker Protocol today. You may now create Vaults with the MANA collateral type on Oasis Borrow. This month’s Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls are still in progress until Monday, August 3. The Community Greenlight Polls for the following collateral types:  [PAX] [WiV] [EURS] [LRC] [renBTC] [AMPL] [HUSD] [USDT] [C20] [BNT] [COMP]    Don’t forget to vote - your vote matters!  Recent MIPs Activity  MIP17 Working Group Call   Given that MIP17 was initially rejected from the Governance Cycle this month and there has been a lot of discussion on how to improve/modify the proposal’s logic to meet Maker’s needs, I held a community call to discuss our options going forward.   Results: A call summary will be provided over the next couple of days in the form of a forum post/thread, and a new proposal will be put forward focusing on Debt Ceiling Adjustments only.    Proposals in the Request for Comments (RFC) Phase:    MIP20  Target Price Adjustment Module (Vox)  In short, this proposal defines a process for adjusting the target price of DAI according to a governance defined rate, allowing the institution of negative effective interest rates.     MIP13c3-SP1  : Declaration of Intent for Forward Guidance (in RFC)  In short, this proposal aims to help Vault users hedge their exposure to the base rate via various derivative contracts.     MIP15  Dark Spell Mechanism  In short, this proposal formalizes a process for applying critical bug fixes to the Maker Protocol as an alternative to an unplanned Emergency Shutdown.    MIP14 Protocol DAI Transfer  In short, this proposal defines a generic process for transferring DAI from the Maker Protocol to a target ethereum address. This process is a fallback method of transferring value from the protocol in the event that a more specific process does not exist to do so.  @LongForWisdom also mentioned that he would be open to having MIP14 be taken over from him to a new champion/Author. So if anyone is interested in taking over MIP14 and working with the community on a resubmission, just ping me (MIP Editor) and I can facilitate the transition of Authorship.    A few Pre-MIP Discussions are still ongoing:  A Governance Chief Contract Redesign A Liquidation System Redesign  Adding a poll to prioritize collateral applications  A TUSD Update  A Governance Poll to Adjust the TUSD Debt Ceiling was posted on Monday, July 27, and will run until Thursday at noon EDT. If the poll passes, the next steps are to propose an Executive Vote for the Debt Ceiling Adjustment this Friday. Further information about the proposed adjustment can be found in this forum post.   /fin

Monthly Governance Cycle Updates  No weekly updates this month as MakerDAO does not have any MIPs or Subproposals going through a governance cycle this month.  MIPs Activity Proposals in the Conception Stage:   MIP44: Reward Join Adapter (RewardJoin)  Proposes a generic vault solution for all tokens with reward.    Proposals in the Request for Comments (RFC) Stage (34!): MIPs   MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign  Proposes a contract replacement for DSChief that comes with improved security, usability and functionality for holders of the Maker governance token (MKR).    MIP31: Active Reserve AMM (dss-ara)  Proposes an active reserve based on Uniswap V2 contract.    MIP32: Peg Stability Module for Compound Mixed Exposure  Provides an extension for the PSM. The extension allows the PSM to leverage USDC via dai using cdai. It also convert USDC to cUSDC using the same join adaptor (lending join).    MIP33: Maker Stability Price Module  Proposes a way for Maker governance to defend a MKR price by pre-allocating dai to buy at a pre-defined level.    MIP34: Keg Streaming Payments Module  Proposes a smart contract implementation of a Streaming Payments System for Maker.    MIP35: Peg Stability Module - Compound Mixed Exposure - With Farming  Defines a new Peg Stability Module which converts USDC to DAI and DAI to USDC.    MIP36: Peg Stability - Compound Governance Dai Leverage   Defines a Peg stabilizer controlled by governance, which uses the flash minting technique with MIP35 or MIP32 for Dai lending to leverage MakerDAO’s position on cDai.    MIP37: Static Reserve For Governance  Defines a static reserve which can receive any tokens from anyone as any contract and allow the Governance to withdraw them.    MIP38: DAO Primitives State  Defines all the state related to Core Units, Budgets and Facilitators.    MIP39: Core Unit Framework  Defines a framework for managing Core Units and modifying them in the DAO Primitives State MIP.    MIP40: Budget Framework  Defines a framework for managing budgets and modifying them in the DAO Primitives State MIP.    MIP41: Facilitator Framework  Defines a framework with subproposal processes for managing Facilitators and modifying them in the DAO Primitives State MIP.    MIP42: Proposed Compensation Addendum for MakerDAO Contributors  Proposes to pay contributors partially in time-locked MKR to increase value returned to contributors and directly align their interests with those of MakerDAO.    MIP43 - Term Lending Module (TLM)  Proposes a Maker module to buy and hold tokenized fixed-rate, fixed-term loans to maturity in order to encourage a fixed-rate lending market.    MIP45: Liquidations 2.0 (LIQ-2.0) - Liquidation System Redesign   Defines and proposes a new Liquidation System for the Maker Protocol.    MIP46: Parameter Proposal Groups  Proposes the formalization of Parameter Proposal Groups.    MIP47: MakerDAO Multisignature Wallet Management  Defines the requirements for creating a Multisignature wallet that is recognized by Maker Governance.    MIP48: Streaming Payments via the Keg  Describes how to utilize the Keg, a method of streaming DAI to various addresses, at a defined rate.    MIP49: Governance Rewards  Proposes the creation of Governance Rewards that would allow the Maker community to reward MKR holders for locking their MKR tokens in Governance.    Subproposals   MIP13c3-SP9: Onboarding a new collateral type backed by B.Protocol  Proposes a native integration between B.Protocol and the MakerDAO system, by on-boarding a new collateral type, with lower CR which will be natively backed by a strong commitment from B.Protocol backstop.    MIP4c2-SP10: MIP0 Amendments  Proposes edits to MIP0 that make it compatible with the newly proposed Domain Framework MIP set. The main changes remove the inbuilt functionality of MIP0 to onboard core personnel and introduce logic that allows Governance Facilitators to designate MIP Editors.    MIP4c2-SP7: MIP4 Amendments  Proposes changes to MIP4. Adding an allowance for MIP amendments to be able to use the Weekly Governance Cycle for the first 3 months after a MIP has passed and an allowance for multiple MIP amendments in one proposal.    MIP4c2-SP12: MIP16 Amendments  This amendment MIP proposes edits to MIP16 that makes it compatible with the newly proposed Core Unit Operating Model MIP set. The main change is to clarify the Governance Powers of Facilitators.    MIP4c2-SP11: MIP24 Amendments  Proposes edits to MIP24 to make it compatible with the newly proposed Core Unit Operating Model MIP set (MIP38, MIP39, MIP40, and MIP41). The main change is to the Governance Facilitator Emergency Vote (MIP24c6) process, which handles the onboarding and offboarding of Facilitators in an attack situation.    MIP39c2-SP3: Governance Core Unit - GOV-001  Proposes a Core Unit for governance because MakerDAO requires a consistent and well-run governance process managed by elected facilitators in order to remain stable and secure as MakerDAO grows.    MIP40c2-SP3: Core Unit Budget - GOV-001  Proposes and details a Core Unit Budget modification for the GovAlpha team.    MIP41c4-SP3: Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding  Proposes LongForWisdom to be onboarded as the Facilitator for the GovAlpha Core Unit. LFW will continue in his current role and will be paid by the Maker Protocol.    MIP39c2-SP2: Adding Risk Core Unit  Proposes the Onboarding of a Risk Core Unit to ensure the Maker Protocol can continue to grow safely by having proper risk management parameters and risk mitigation tools applied.    MIP40c2-SP2: Add Core Unit Budget (Risk Core Unit)  Proposes a budget implementation for the Risk Core Unit.    MIP41c4-SP2: Risk Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding  Proposes Primož Kordež to be onboarded as the Facilitator for the Risk Core Unit. Primož will continue in his current role and will be paid by the Maker Protocol.    MIP39c2-SP1: Adding Core Unit (Real-World Finance)  Proposes the addition of a Real-World Finance Core Unit. This Core Unit is designed to pursue Real-World Asset work and more generally helps MakerDAO to take over the traditional finance world.    MIP40c2-SP1: Modify Core Unit Budget (Real-World Finance)  Proposes a budget implementation for the Real-World Finance Core Unit.    MIP41c4-SP1: Facilitator Onboarding (Real-World Finance)  Proposes Sébastien Derivaux to be onboarded as the Facilitator for the Real-World Finance Core Unit. Seb wants to push his contribution to the MakerDAO to the next level by creating a Core Unit.    MIP0c12-SP3: Subproposal for Core Personnel Onboarding (MIP Editor)  Proposes to onboard David Utrobin as a MIP Editor.    Pre-MIP Discussions Ongoing Discussions  PSM flapper (Improvements/Changes to MIP35) Vaults with LR << CR Collateralization of Commodities for purposes of financing duties and tariffs Liquidations 2.0: Technical Summary   /fin

Last Week’s Activity (Start of the August Governance Cycle) Monday  August’s Governance Cycle officially began on August 3. There were no polls or votes scheduled last week related to MIPs. The Formal Submission period was from August 3 to August 5.  This period is when MIPs/Subproposals in the RFC phase are proposed to enter the governance cycle.    The Formal Submission entries for August’s Governance Cycle were:  MIP0c13-SP1 - Core Personnel Offboarding (Richard Brown) MIP13c3-SP1 - Declaration of Intent (Forward Guidance) MIP12c2-SP4 - LRC Collateral Onboarding  Thursday  The Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) performed the Submission Review to determine which of the formally submitted Subproposals should be put forth for Inclusion Polls on Monday, August 10.   Results: All three of the proposals were confirmed to move to Inclusion Polls on Monday.    This Week’s Activity (Inclusion Polls) Monday  Inclusion Polls for the three Subproposals that were formally submitted will be proposed on Monday, August 10, and will run until August 13 at noon EST.  Thursday  During the weekly Governance and Risk Call, the Governance Facilitator will perform the Inclusion Poll Review and determine which of the three Subproposals are eligible for the Governance Poll the following Monday (July 20).  As a reminder, in order for Inclusion Polls to successfully pass, the Yes votes for a given option in the inclusion poll must be higher than the combination of No votes plus the Default Inclusion Threshold (DIT).  Yes > (No + DIT) = Allows inclusion in the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll.   The DIT is currently set to 3000 MKR.    Other News Collateral Onboarding   MANA was officially onboarded to the Maker Protocol last Tuesday. You may now create Vaults with the MANA collateral type on Oasis Borrow.   As mentioned above, Loopring (LRC) is planned to go through the Monthly Governance Cycle this month.   The Weekly Governance Cycle will be used for USDT and PAXUSD once the risk evaluations have been published. Timelines are still being discussed by the Domain teams.   This month’s Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls ended on Monday, August 3. The Community Greenlight Polls results can be seen in the below table:   Screen Shot 2020-08-04 at 8.02.07 PM992×710 71.6 KB MIPs Update  MIP17 Working Group Call   MIP17 Working Group Call Summary  Next Steps  I and @Planet_X are working to finalize the proposal draft and share it with the rest of the working group when completed. As it stands, I believe it still needs to show how we can reduce the uncertainty around when the debt ceiling will be increased beyond its current maximum as well as add an agreed-upon mechanism to help increase DCs. If anyone else is interested in helping draft the new proposal, please comment in the thread or reach out to @charlesstlouis on the Maker Rocket.Chat.    The following proposals are still in Request for Comments (RFC) stage:    MIP20: Target Price Adjustment Module-(Vox)   In short, this proposal defines a process for adjusting DAI’s target price according to a governance-defined rate, allowing the institution of negative effective interest rates. There will be an overview presentation on this week’s Governance and Risk call to showcase the proposal further and provide a period for discussion.     MIP17: Weekly Actual Debt Ceiling Adjustments   In short, this proposal defines and formalizes a solution using the Weekly Governance Cycle (MIP16) for making weekly Actual Debt Ceiling Adjustments. Furthermore, the proposal describes how to propose modifications to the calculation logic behind the debt ceiling adjustments. The new version of this proposal is still a work in progress, as mentioned above.     MIP15: Dark Spell Mechanism   In short, this proposal formalizes a process for applying critical bug fixes to the Maker Protocol as an alternative to an unplanned Emergency Shutdown. This proposal’s feedback period ends at the end of August, making it eligible for inclusion in September’s Governance Cycle.     MIP14: Protocol Dai Transfer   In short, this proposal defines a generic process for transferring DAI from the Maker Protocol to a target ethereum address. This process is a fallback method of transferring value from the Maker Protocol.  @LongForWisdom is looking for a new author from the community to champion this proposal going forward.    A few of the Pre-MIP Discussions that are still ongoing:  A Governance Chief Contract Redesign A Liquidation System Redesign  Adding a poll to prioritize collateral applications  TUSD Update  The team at TrustToken recently posted a response to the Smart Contract Domain team’s implementation concerns. The post can be viewed here. The TrustToken team is working towards a new TUSD token upgrade that will significantly simplify the code and reduce the attack surface. The Maker Smart Contracts team has reviewed TCAD, which was simplified in many of the same ways that TUSD will be simplified in their upcoming upgrade. Once this new TUSD code is ready, the Maker smart contracts team will review the new implementation again and create another poll to adjust risk parameters.   /fin

MIPs Activity Proposals in the Conception Stage MIPs   MIP44: Reward Join Adapter (RewardJoin)   Proposes a generic vault solution for all tokens with reward.    Proposals in the Request for Comments Stage MIPs   MIP31: Active Reserve AMM (dss-ara)  A technical proposal for an active reserve based on Uniswap V2 contract.    MIP32: Peg Stability Module for Compound Mixed Exposure  Provides an extension for the PSM. The extension allows the PSM to leverage USDC via dai using cdai. It also convert USDC to cUSDC using the same join adaptor (lending join).    MIP33: Maker Stability Price Module  This proposal allows the governance to defend a MKR price by pre-allocating dai to buy at a pre-defined level.    MIP35: Peg Stability Module - Compound Mixed Exposure - With Farming  This proposal defines a new Peg Stability Module which converts USDC to DAI and DAI to USDC.    MIP36: Peg Stability - Compound Governance Dai Leverage  This proposal defines a Peg stabilizer controlled by governance, which uses the flash minting technique with MIP35 or MIP32 for Dai lending to leverage MakerDAO’s position on cDai.    MIP37: Static Reserve For Governance  Defines a static reserve which can receive any tokens from anyone as any contract and allow the Governance to withdraw them.    MIP42: Proposed Compensation Addendum for MakerDAO Contributors  Proposes to pay contributors partially in time-locked MKR to increase value returned to contributors and directly align their interests with those of MakerDAO.    MIP47: MakerDAO Multisignature Wallet Management  Defines the requirements for creating a Multisignature wallet that is owned by Maker Governance and utilized by community members.    MIP49: Governance Rewards  Proposes the creation of Governance Rewards that would allow the Maker community to reward MKR holders for locking their MKR tokens in Governance.    Declarations Of Intent   MIP13c3-SP9: Onboarding a new collateral type backed by B.Protocol  This Declaration of intent asks MakerDAO to consider an experiment for a native integration between B.Protocol and the MakerDAO system, by on-boarding a new collateral type, namely WBTC-B or ETH-C, with lower CR than WBTC-A or ETH-B (respectively), which will be natively backed by a strong commitment from B.Protocol backstop.    MIP13c3-SP10: Declaration of Intent - eurDai  Analysis of a EUR-pegged DAI.    Amendments   MIP4c2-SP11: MIP24 Amendments  Proposes edits to MIP24 that makes it compatible with the newly proposed Core Unit Operating Model MIP set. The main change included is to the Governance Facilitator Emergency Vote process, which directly deals with onboarding and offboarding Facilitators.    MIP4c2-SP7: MIP4 Amendments  Proposes changes to MIP4 that make new MIP amendments more flexible and allow for multiple amendments to be proposed as a single proposal if they are related.    MIP4c2-SP13: MIP0 Amendments  Integrates the concept of MIP Sets to MIP0.    Core Unit Subproposals  Growth Core Unit:  MIP39c2-SP4: Growth Core Unit, GRO-001 MIP40c2-SP4: Core Unit Budget, GRO-001 MIP41c4-SP4: Facilitator Onboarding, GRO-001    Pre-MIP Discussions New Discussions! Last Week’s Activity (August 10-14) Monday  Inclusion Polls for the three subproposals (noted below) were proposed on Monday, August 10, and ran until August 13 at noon EST.  Inclusion Poll Results:   MIP0c13-SP1 - Core Personnel Offboarding (Richard Brown)  (PASS)   MIP13c3-SP1 - Declaration of Intent (Forward Guidance) (PASS)   MIP12c2-SP4 - LRC Collateral Onboarding (REJECTED)     Thursday  During the weekly Governance and Risk Call, the Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) performed the Inclusion Poll Review and confirmed that two of the three formally submitted subproposals would be included in the Monthly MIPs Governance Poll on Monday, August, 17.  Governance and Risk Call recording     This Week’s Activity (Monthly MIPs Governance Poll, August 17 - 21) Monday  The Monthly MIPs Governance Poll went live today at noon EST.  The Monthly Governance Poll will be active for approximately three days ending August 20 before the Thursday Governance and Risk call. This poll asks whether the bundled contents of this month’s Governance Cycle should proceed to an Executive Vote to be held on August 24, 2020. The bundled contents of this poll consist of the following two subproposals:  MIP13c3-SP1: Declaration of Intent (Forward Guidance) MIP0c13-SP1: Subproposal for Core Personnel Offboarding      Thursday  The Governance Facilitators will perform the Governance Poll Review as part of the Governance and Risk meeting. They will confirm the poll’s outcomes in preparation for Week 4’s Monthly MIPs Executive Vote that will occur on Monday, August 24.  Other News Collateral Onboarding  As mentioned previously, the Weekly Governance Cycle will be used for the onboarding of PAXUSD and USDT (Tether).  A tentative timeline (to be confirmed by the domain teams):  The PAXUSD and USDT Governance Polls will go live on Monday, August 24. If the Governance Poll passes, the Executive Vote would be published on September 4.      [LRC Onboarding] Given that LRC was rejected in the Inclusion poll stage of this month’s Governance Cycle, a Signal Request was put up on the official forums to gauge sentiment regarding the timing of its resubmission. The signal poll will run until August 23, 2020, at 12:00 PM EST.   @LongForWisdom made an excellent point, stating the following:  “We could use the weekly cycle, but I think that sets a really bad precedent for governance, so there would have to be a good reason for me to consider allowing it (which I don’t think exists given the proposed debt ceiling on LRC is only 3 million.) As a general rule, if something is voted out of the monthly cycle at the inclusion stage, it seems a bit scummy to allow a re-vote in the same month because the community didn’t like the outcome. To some extent, I’d also like larger MKR voters to see this as a relatively low-cost lesson and hopefully, an incentive to vote more consistently in on-chain polls.”   In summary, the results of this signal poll will provide a signal from the community to the domain teams that the community would like to see LRC resubmitted into September’s Governance Cycle.   This month’s Collateral Onboarding Community Greenlight Polls went live today and will run for two weeks ending on Monday, August 31. There is a total of 12 polls covering the following collateral types:  Screen Shot 2020-08-13 at 11.56.09 AM1250×678 63.4 KB    Collateral Status Index   This index was created to help the community to track the current statuses of all proposed collateral types. MIP15: Dark Spell Mechanism   This proposal’s feedback period ends at the end of August, making it eligible for inclusion in September’s Governance Cycle.     MIP14: Protocol Dai Transfer    @LongForWisdom is looking for a new author from the community to champion this proposal going forward. Weekly MIPs Update #127   Uncertain as to when to post your proposals, when the cutoff date for modifications take place, et cetera? Please refer to this forum post.  1500×900 148 KB   Weekly-Cycle Proposals  Upcoming Short Ratification Poll MIP55c3-SP15: Phoneix Labs Initial Funding SPF will enter the Weekly Governance Cycle next week. The SPF requests 50,000 DAI for legal and incorporation expenses of Phoenix Labs, an R&D company focused on creating new products for MakerDAO. The proposal will go on-chain for three days, starting Monday, March 06.   “Wait, wasn’t this one supposed to go on-chain today, Monday 27?”. We had a bit of a slip-up there: We did announce it as going up today because we thought it was ready, but then noticed that one of the comptrollers was missing — it’s now been added and the proposal will be going up on-chain one week from now, once it’s Frozen Period has been satisfied. Sorry about that.   Monthly Governance Cycle February’s Ratification Polls closed today. These are the results:     Code and Title Summary Results       MIP13c3-SP14: Implement a Feature to Refund People who Lost Money Sending Dai to the Dai Contract Address  Link  800×212 10.3 KB      MIP95: Simple To Onboard RWA, $100M in Cogent Bank Loan Participations  Link  805×221 10.2 KB      MIP4c2-SP30: Amend Interim Facilitator Appointment Process  Link  800×223 9.29 KB      MIP4c2-SP33: Amend MIP62 to Allow for Changing Communication Responsibilities  Link  800×216 9.42 KB     So two proposals were approved, namely:   MIP4c2-SP30, which amends the Facilitator onboarding process so as to require less Governance input in order to make the process speedier and minimize disruption to the relevant Core Unit’s continuity among other changes. Please refer to the summary by GovAlpha por more details.  MIP4c2-SP33, which amends MIP62 to replace explicit references to the offboarded GovComms Core Unit with a more general “Communication Coordinator” role and assigns GovAlpha to it, among other changes. Please refer to the summary by GovAlpha por more details.   Latest Proposals in RFC Here is a list of our latest proposals in RFC. Most of them are eligible to enter March Governance Cycle — except for MIP117: RWA Master Participation Trust to Onboard LoanStreet as Loan Liquidator, eligible for April at the earliest, and MIP55c3-SP15, which will enter the weekly cycle on Monday, March 06. Weekly MIPs Update #38   1060×655 39.4 KB   Last Week | May 24 - 28  Monday  Monday marked the beginning of the final week of the May governance cycle. The Monthly MIPs Executive Vote went live on Monday, May 24th at approximately 4pm UTC, and passed on May 25th. Thus, the following proposals have been Accepted:      Proposal Title Type     MIP50: Direct Deposit Module Technical MIP   MIP51: Monthly Governance Cycle Process MIP   MIP39c2-SP10: Sustainable Ecosystem Scaling Core Unit Mandate, SES-001 Core Unit   MIP40c3-SP10: Core Unit Budget, SES-001 Core Unit   MIP41c4-SP10: Facilitator Onboarding, SES-001 Core Unit   MIP4c2-SP14: MIP0 Amendments Amendment     Thursday  Governance Facilitator @LongForWisdom reviewed the outcome of the Monthly MIPs Executive Vote during the weekly Governance Call.   This Week | May 31 - June 4  Monday  It’s a gap week! That means no Monthy Cycle events will take place during this week. May’s Community Greenlight Polls, linked below, went live on May 17th and ended on May 31st, after the mandatory two weeks–they all passed!       Collateral MIP9 Poll MIP6 Application     CEL (Celsius Network Token) Greenlit Application   PA-DROP (PandaCredit DROP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-SNX-ETH (Sushiswap SNX-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-UNI-ETH (Sushiswap UNI-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-YFI-ETH (Sushiswap YFI-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-AAVE-ETH (Sushiswap AAVE-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-COMP-ETH (Sushiswap COMP-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-ETH-USDT (Sushiswap ETH-USDT LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-LINK-ETH (Sushiswap LINK-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-USDC-ETH (Sushiswap USDC-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-WBTC-ETH (Sushiswap WBTC-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application   SLP-SUSHI-ETH (Sushiswap SUSHI-ETH LP Token) Greenlit Application     Thursday  This week’s Governance and Risk Call can be used to talk about the upcoming Governance Cycle, formal submission preparation, et cetera.   Next Week | June 7 - June 11  Monday  June’s Governance Cycle will begin on Monday, June 7.  The Monthly Governance Cycle has changed!  Graphic in the header displays the new configuration. No more MIP executive votes! All MIPs and Subproposals now go through individual two-week Ratification Polls unless they are part of the same mip-set.   The Formal Submission Window for June will be from June 7 - 9.  Proposals must have no changes since June 2nd to be eligible.   The Monthly MIPs Executive Vote will be published. The vote will be active for four days; if the Executive Vote does not pass before the four-day limit expires, all of the vote’s bundled proposals will effectively be rejected.   Thursday  Governance Facilitator @LongForWisdom will perform the Governance Cycle Review during the weekly Governance Call. Last Week’s Activity (March 1 - 5) Monday  Formal Submission for the March Governance Cycle began last week on Monday, March 1, and ended on Wednesday, March 3. There were a total of 21 proposals formally submitted last week of the 32 eligible. This includes:   Core Unit / DAO Structure MIPs Set & Amendments  MIP38: DAO Primitives State MIP39: Core Unit Framework MIP40: Budget Framework MIP41: Facilitator Framework MIP4c2-SP12: MIP16 Amendments MIP4c2-SP10: MIP0 Amendments    Keg  MIP34: Keg Streaming Payments Module MIP48: Streaming Payments via the Keg    Technical Proposals  MIP43 - Term Lending Module (TLM) MIP45: Liquidations 2.0 (LIQ-2.0) - Liquidation System Redesign    General Proposals  MIP46: Parameter Proposal Groups MIP47: MakerDAO Multisignature Wallet Management    Real-World Finance Core Unit Onboarding  MIP39c2-SP1: Adding Core Unit (Real-World Finance) MIP40c2-SP1: Modify Core Unit Budget (Real-World Finance) MIP41c4-SP1: Facilitator Onboarding (Real-World Finance)    Risk Core Unit Onboarding  MIP39c2-SP2: Adding Risk Core Unit MIP40c2-SP2: Add Core Unit Budget (Risk Core Unit) MIP41c4-SP2: Risk Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding    Governance Core Unit Onboarding  MIP39c2-SP3: Governance Core Unit - GOV-001 MIP40c2-SP3: Core Unit Budget - GOV-001 MIP41c4-SP3: Core Unit Facilitator Onboarding      Thursday  During the weekly governance and risk call, all 21 proposals were confirmed to proceed to the Inclusion Poll stage on Monday, March 8. Endgame MIPs are:  MIP0 MIP16 MIP24 MIP38 MIP39 MIP40 MIP41 MIP51 MIP55 MIP62 And the above listed Endgame Constitution MIPs    Note that the passing of MIP102c2-SP1 therefore precludes any MIP that’s not contained in this list (and any SP not derived from those MIPs) from being/remaining accepted and active in the Maker Protocol. This also includes those SPFs that are eligible to enter the March Governance Cycle. Last Week’s Activity (November 23 - 27) Monday  Monday marked the start of the final week of November’s Governance Cycle. The Monthly MIPs Executive Vote was published (“Approve November 2020 Governance Cycle MIPs Bundle”), officially passed on November 24, and was executed on November 27, 2020.  Outcomes:   MIP24: Emergency Voting System has moved to the Accepted status.  MakerDAO now has a formal procedure when dealing with emergencies and other urgent issues.    MIP25: Flash Mint Module has moved to the Accepted status.  MakerDAO may now implement (pending technical review by the domain teams) a module that enables any user to execute a flash mint of Dai.    MIP27: Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module has moved to the Accepted status.  MakerDAO may now implement (pending technical review by the domain teams) a Debt Ceiling Instant Access Module (DC-IAM), which allows any user to adjust the debt ceiling within constraints that are voted on by Governance.    MIP28: Operational Support Domain Definition has moved to the Accepted status.  MakerDAO now has an official Operational Support Domain.    MIP4c2-SP6: Calendar Exceptions has moved to the Accepted status.  There will be no Monthly Governance Cycle in December.    MIP13c3-SP6: SourceCred Funding has moved to the Accepted status.  MakerDAO has expressed intent to fund the use of SourceCred within the Maker Community to incentivize effective Governance of the Maker Protocol.    MIP28c7-SP1: Subproposal for Operational Support Domain Facilitator Onboarding has moved to the Accepted status.   @Amyjung has been officially onboarded as an Operational Support Facilitator!      Thursday  There was no Governance and Risk call last week due to holidays.  Thus, the Governance Facilitator @LongForWisdom will perform the Governance Cycle Review this Thursday (December 3).    This Week’s Activity (November 30 - December 4) Monday  Due to the recent ratification of November’s Monthly MIPs Executive Vote (Approve November 2020 Governance Cycle MIPs Bundle), the Monthly Governance Cycle will not be occurring for the month of December. For further details about the calendar exception, please see the newly Accepted MIP4c2-SP6: Calendar Exceptions proposal.  Thursday  As mentioned above, the Governance Facilitator (@LongForWisdom) will perform the Governance Cycle Review this Thursday (December 3). This includes summarizing November’s Governance Cycle and opening up the floor for feedback and questions from the community discussing any plans for the next Governance Cycle in January.  Collateral Onboarding Updates  Three Governance Polls for Collateral Onboarding have been published to the voting portal and will end on Thursday, December 3. The Governance Polls are for signaling support for/against adding the following collateral types in a future Executive Vote:   Add renBTC as a Collateral Type.  Add RWA-001 (6s Capital) as a Collateral Type.  Add UNI (Uniswap) as a Collateral Type.   The Executive Vote to onboard the GUSD collateral type to the Maker Protocol officially passed on November 18 and executed on November 23, 2020. The Community Greenlight Polls for November were published on November 16 and ended today (November 30). The Community Greenlight Polls covered [NEXO] and [YFII].   Results: Both Collateral types were voted to be deferred .   For more details on the status of Collateral Onboarding, check out the Collateral Prioritization Framework spreadsheet here.  MIPs Activity Proposals in the Request for Comments (RFC) Stage: MIPs  MIP17: Weekly Actual Debt Ceiling Adjustments MIP26: DssGov - Governance Contract Redesign MIP29 - Peg Stability Module MIP30: Farmable cUSDC Adapter (CropJoin)  Subproposals  MIP13c3-SP7: Governance Communications (Declaration of Intent) MIP13c3-SP8: Maker Protocol Cover with Nexus Mutual (Declaration of Intent)  Pre-MIP Discussions New Discussions  Real estate tokenization protocol: A Pre-MIP Discussion PSM based on cDai - different than the actual PSM logic  Pre-MIP discussion: Incentives to align interests of Maker workers with MKR holder Ideas on DAI PEG, USDC-A vault, fees, etc. A basic analysis + suggestions  Ongoing Discussions   MakerDAO Protocol Cover using Nexus Mutual.  FlapperDistributor: A Way to Distribute System Surplus while Minimizing Governance.  Liquidations 2.0: Technical Summary.  Replace the mechanism to burn $MKR with a treasury.   /fin
